705.01 LICENSES REQUIRED.
   No person shall be engaged in any trade, business or occupation mentioned in
this chapter until he has obtained a license therefor as provided in this
chapter.
705.02 APPLICATION AND ISSUANCE.
   Every person engaged in any trade, business or occupation for which a
license is imposed by this chapter shall, at the time of procuring the license,
make application to the City Manager and shall state such facts as may be
applicable to the license. In cases where the Chief of Police requests the City
Manager, in writing, to require that the application and statement of facts be
made under oath or affirmation, the same shall be so made. The City Manager
shall, if the applicant qualified for the granting of the license applied for
or any renewal, direct the City Auditor, in writing, to issue the particular
license applied for upon the payment of the amount of money required by law to
be paid for the license or any renewal, and the City Auditor shall issue the
license to the applicant with a certificate of payment stating the particular
kind of license issued and the amount paid therefor. (Ord. 2016-87. Passed 9-
26-16.)
705.03 AUDITOR TO SIGN AND RECORD.
   The City Auditor shall sign licenses provided for in this chapter and keep a
record of such licenses in his office.
705.04 CONTENTS.
   Licenses for any business, trade or occupation conducted at any particular
or fixed locality shall authorize the transaction of such business by an
individual, firm or corporation. Every such license shall specify by name the
person to whom it has been issued and shall designate the particular place at
which the business is to be carried on.
705.05 TRANSFERABILITY.
   No license granted or issued under any of the provisions of this chapter
shall in any manner be assigned or transferred. No license shall authorize any
person other than the one named in the license to do business. No license shall
authorize any other business than is named in the license to be done or
transacted at any place other than is named in the license without the
permission of the City Manager endorsed thereon. The City Auditor shall, at the
time of the granting of such permission, immediately record such change or
transfer upon the proper record. (Ord. 2016-88. Passed 9-26-16.)
705.06 TERM.
   All licenses provided for in this chapter, except as otherwise provided,
shall date from January 1 preceding their date of issue and shall be issued for
one year from such date.
705.07 EVIDENCE OF LIABILITY TO PAY FEE.
   In the trial of any action brought under the provisions of this chapter, the
fact that any party to such action represented himself as engaged in any
business, trade or occupation for the transaction of which a license is
required, or as the keeper, proprietor or manager of the things for which a
license is required, or that such party exhibited a sign indicating such
business or calling, or such proprietorship or management, shall be evidence of
the liability of such party to pay for the license.
705.08 DISPLAY; PRODUCTION UPON APPLYING FOR RENEWAL.
   Every person having a license under the provisions of this chapter shall
exhibit such license at all times while in force, in some conspicuous part of
his place of business and shall produce the license when applying for a renewal
or when any request is made to produce it by any member of the Department of
Police or by any municipal officer.
705.09 RENEWALS TO PERSONS DISCHARGED FROM ARMED SERVICES.
   Any person who, at the time he held or holds any license issued by the City,
enlists in the armed services of the United States or is commissioned in the
armed services, or is called into the armed services in consequence of an act
of Congress, the call of the President of the United States, or due to his
status in the reserve forces, National Guard or other similar defense
organization, and which license expired or expires during the term of such
service in the armed services may, within ninety days after receiving a
discharge other than a dishonorable, bad conduct or discharge indicating other
than honorable service on the part of the licensee, apply for a renewal of the
license. If the licensee qualifies in all other respects for a renewal of the
license, such license shall be renewed upon payment of the same fee that the
licensee would have been required to pay for a renewal of the license if such
license had been renewed at the expiration of the license previously issued.
However, if the amount of the fee for the renewal of such license has been
increased or decreased between the date of the expiration of the previous
license and the date of the application for renewal, the applicant shall pay
the fee in effect at the date of the application for renewal.
   The term "armed services of the United States", as used in this section,
includes the following: Army, Navy, Marine Corps, Air Force, Coast Guard, or
National Guard.
(Ord. 2016-89. Passed 9-26-16.)
705.10 REVOCATION.
   (a)   If, at any time, any person licensed to transact any business under
the provisions of this chapter shall have been convicted of a violation of any
ordinance or law relating to the operation of such business, the City Manager
shall revoke such license and such licensed person shall cease to have any
authority thereunder.
   (b)   If at any time it shall be made to appear to the satisfaction of the
Chief of Police that any licensed person has violated any of the provisions of
this chapter or if it shall be made to appear that the holder of a license
under this chapter shall permit any noisy, boisterous, disorderly, lewd,
immoral or obscene conduct, or permit any vulgar, licentious or obscene
language in the place so licensed or permit intoxicated persons to frequent
such place or to remain therein, or if any person so licensed should conduct
his place in such a manner as to be a nuisance to the neighborhood or to the
occupants of premises situated near the licensed place, the Chief of Police
shall revoke such license and such licensed person shall cease to have any
authority thereunder and shall be barred from obtaining a license for a similar
business for a period of one year. Notice of such revocation of such license
shall be made in writing and signed by the Chief of Police, effective
immediately. The holder of the license so revoked may demand a hearing by
filing a written demand therefor within three days with the City Manager
whereupon the City Manager shall designate a time for the hearing which shall
not be at a date later than five days following the filing of a demand
therefor. Following the hearing, the City Manager may modify, cancel or affirm
his original revocation, which action shall be final.
(Ord. 2016-90. Passed 9-26-16.)

705.19 PUSHCARTS FOR COLLECTING JUNK.
   Every person who shall engage in the business of operating a pushcart or
other similar vehicle within the City for the purpose of collecting trash,
rubbish, junk or other personal property, shall pay a license fee of fifty
dollars ($50.00) per annum.
(Ord. 2016-98. Passed 9-26-16.)
705.20 HOUSEHOLD MOVERS; FEE; RECORDS AND REPORTS. (REPEALED)

 705.20 was repealed by Ordinance 2016-99, passed September 26, 2016.)
705.21 JUNK SHOPS, SECOND-HAND DEALERS AND ANTIQUE DEALERS.
   (a)   Every person carrying on the business of operating a junk shop, and
who for that purpose carries on such business from and in a storeroom or other
building within the City, shall pay an annual license fee of one hundred
dollars ($100.00) for each location.
 
   (b)   Every person carrying on the business of dealing in second-hand
articles or antique articles, and who for that purpose carries on such business
from and in a storeroom or other building within the City, shall pay an annual
license fee of twenty dollars ($20.00) for each location. Carrying on or
operating a junk shop or a business or dealing in second-hand or antique
articles within the meaning of this section is hereby defined to be any such
business operated as defined in this section in which the gross volume of such
business equals or exceeds fifty percent (50%) of the total operations of any
such business from any such location.
 
   (c)   Every person engaged in the business of buying gold or other precious
metals, and who for that purpose carries on such business exclusively from and
in a storeroom or other building within the City, shall pay an annual license
fee of twenty dollars ($20.00).
 
   (d)   Every person engaged in the business of buying second-hand articles,
gold or other precious metal, by canvassing or soliciting from door to door or
house to house, shall pay an annual license fee of fifty dollars ($50.00) for
each solicitor or person so engaged.
 
   (e)   Each person so licensed shall be required to keep the records and make
the reports required in Section
705.24.
 
   (f)   State licensed pawnshops or pawnbrokers are exempt from the
requirements under Section
705.21.
(Ord. 2016-24. Passed 5-9-16.)
705.22 SECOND-HAND AUTOMOBILE DEALERS.
   Every dealer engaged in the business of buying, selling, trading or
negotiating the buying, selling or trading of second-hand automobiles shall pay
a license fee of two hundred fifty dollars ($250.00).
(Ord. 2016-123. Passed 10-10-16.)
705.23 AUTOMOBILE WRECKERS.
   Every wrecker of automobiles shall pay a license fee of one hundred dollars
($100.00) per annum. The holder of a license to engage in the business of a
wrecker of automobiles shall be permitted to buy, sell, trade or negotiate the
buying, selling or trading of second-hand automobiles without procuring the
license provided for in Section
705.22.
(Ord. 1975-121. Passed 12-23-75.)
705.24 RECORDS AND REPORTS FOR AUTOMOBILE WRECKERS, SECOND-HAND DEALERS AND
JUNK SHOPS.
   It shall be the duty of each person to whom a license is issued under
Section
705.21 et seq. to keep a separate book open to inspection by any member of the
Department of Police or any municipal officer, in which shall be written in the
English language at the time of the purchase, exchange or receipt of any such
second-hand articles, junk, used automobiles or automobile parts, accessories
or any other articles or things, a description thereof, the name, description
and residence of the person from whom purchased or received, and the date and
hour when such purchase or exchange was made. The holder of such license shall
further prepare and deliver on Monday of each week to the Chief of Police a
legible and correct copy written in English, from such book, containing a
description of each article, to include model and serial number, or thing
purchased or received during the preceding week, the date and hour at which the
purchase was made or the article or thing received, and a description of the
person from whom it was purchased. Failure to keep the book required or to make
the weekly report required herein shall be a misdemeanor. (Ord. 2003-55. Passed
6-9-03.)
705.25   PEDDLERS OF GOODS AND/OR SERVICES DOOR TO DOOR. .
   Peddlers selling goods carried by hand shall pay a license fee of one
hundred dollars ($100.00) per year and an additional twenty dollars ($20.00)
for each employee of any person granted a license hereunder.
   Such license may be granted by the City Manager when, after investigation by
the City Manager, it is found that such applicant is to engage in a legitimate
business and that the reputation of the applicant warrants the issuing of such
a license and that the issuance of the license is not a detriment to the City.
   The granting of any license as provided in this section shall not be
construed as giving any privilege to the licensee of using any space for the
display of merchandise upon any street, sidewalk or other public place.
   This section shall not apply to any civic organization, non-profit
organization or any youth fund raising activities for schools or youth sports.
(Ord. 2016-124. Passed 10-10-16.)
705.26 PEDDLERS OF GOODS CARRIED IN VEHICLES. (REPEALED)
   (EDITOR’S NOTE: Former Section
705.26 was repealed by Ordinance 2016-100, passed September 26, 2016.)
705.27 PEDDLER'S LICENSES; REDUCED FEES IN CERTAIN CASES. (REPEALED)
   (EDITOR’S NOTE: Former Section
705.27 was repealed by Ordinance 2016-101, passed September 26, 2016.)
705.28 RESTRICTIONS ON HUCKSTERS AND PEDDLERS. (REPEALED)
   (EDITOR’S NOTE: Former Section
705.28 was repealed by Ordinance 2016-102, passed September 26, 2016.)
705.29 STREET VENDORS.
   Street vendors or persons selling consumable food, beverages or merchandise
not otherwise prohibited by this chapter upon the streets, sidewalks or other
public place shall pay an annual license fee of one hundred dollars ($100.00).
Such license shall be subject to the following conditions:
   (a)   No merchandise, food or beverage shall be displayed or sold in a
manner that blocks, obstructs or restricts the free passage of pedestrians or
vehicles in the lawful use of the sidewalks, streets or public places.
   (b)   All merchandise, food, or beverages shall be displayed or sold from a
portable or mobile stand or container. Each vendor shall remove all
merchandise, packaging, paper, containers, display stands or tables, or other
materials brought by him to the location at the termination of sales each day.
No permanent stands or displays are permitted.
   (c)   Each vendor during the period of his selling shall keep the area
surrounding the location where he displays merchandise, food or beverages, free
from all litter and debris arising from his operations, including the litter
which arises from actions of his customers in disposing of wrapping or
packaging materials on merchandise sold by the vendor. Each vendor shall also
have a suitable refuse receptacle at his place of business.
   (d)   Vendors shall at all times exercise reasonable care that their
merchandise, packaging material, display equipment and other paraphernalia
shall not create a safety or health hazard.
   (e)   No vendor's display stand, cart, container or other appurtenances or
paraphernalia shall be more that forty-six inches wide nor more than ninety-
three inches long.
   (f)   No merchandise, food or beverages shall be displayed or sold within
forty feet of the location at which another vendor is already displaying or
selling merchandise, food or beverage. In the case of a dispute between
vendors, the vendor who arrived first on the day involved shall be deemed to
have the privilege of operating at that location on that day.
   (g)   Each vendor shall at all times be subject to any rules and regulations
promulgated by the Portsmouth Board of Health and if food or beverages are to
be sold, a license must be obtained from the Board of Health prior to opening
for business.
   (h)   Nothing herein shall permit a vendor to sell refreshment concessions
within the various parks and Spartan Stadium unless the vendor has entered into
a contract with the City as called for in Section
947.10 of the Streets, Utilities and Public Services Code.
   The City Manager may, upon request of a trade association, group of at least
three business firms or a nonprofit social or civic organization whose programs
benefit the community, issue a license to such a group permitting the sale of
merchandise, consumable food or beverages upon the streets, sidewalks or other
public places. The fee for such a license shall be thirty dollars ($30.00) per
sale day, and issuance of such license shall be at the discretion of the City
Manager. (Ord. 2016-125. Passed 10-10-16.)
705.30 DEALERS IN FIREARMS AND AMMUNITION; FEE; RECORDS AND REPORTS. (REPEALED)
   (EDITOR’S NOTE: Former Section
705.30 was repealed by Ordinance 2007-72.)
705.31 ITINERANT VENDORS; LICENSE; FEE.
   Any person engaging in the business or trade of itinerant vendor shall pay a
license fee of one hundred dollars ($100.00) per annum. No such license shall
be granted until the applicant therefor has furnished a bond signed by a surety
company authorized to do business in the State, approved as to sufficiency by
the City Manager and as to form by the City Solicitor, conditioned to reimburse
any person for any and all damages resulting from any act on the part of the
licensee or his agent or employee or from the failure of the licensee to carry
out any contract entered into by him or in his behalf with any person or any
obligation entered into by the licensee by or in behalf of the licensee while
conducting the business of itinerant vendor under the license issued under the
authority of this section. Such bonds shall be in the amount of one thousand
dollars ($1,000).
   Every person preparing to engage in any business set out in this chapter
shall, unless the City Manager is satisfied that the business about to be
engaged in is of a permanent nature and not that of an itinerant vendor, be
required to secure a license as an itinerant vendor and give bond as provided
for in the first paragraph of this section. If, after nine months from the date
of the issuing of the license, the holder thereof is still engaged in his
business as originally opened, the City Auditor is hereby authorized, upon a
proper warrant signed by the City Manager, to refund the fee paid to obtain the
license to such licensee and release the licensee from the obligation of giving
bond.
   The words "itinerant vendor", as used in this section, mean and include all
persons, both principals and agents, who engage in or conduct a temporary or
transient business in the City selling goods, wares or merchandise, or who
engage in the business of taking photographs, with the intention of continuing
in such business in the City for a period of not more than nine months and who,
for the purpose of carrying on such business, hire, lease or occupy, either in
whole or in part, any room, building or structure for the exhibition and sale
of such goods, wares and merchandise.
(Ord. 2016-103. Passed 9-26-16.)
705.32 ITINERANT VENDORS; EXEMPTIONS.
   The provisions of Section
705.31 shall not apply to sales made to dealers by commercial travelers or
selling agents in the usual course of business, nor to bona fide goods, wares
and merchandise by samples for future delivery, nor to peddlers or hucksters.
705.33 OPEN MARKETS.
   Notwithstanding the provisions of Section
705.29, a license may be granted by the City Manager permitting the
establishment of an open market for the sale of produce upon request by a
nonprofit social or civic organization. The fee for such license shall be fifty
dollars ($50.00) per year, per organization.
(Ord. 2016-126. Passed 10-10-16.)
705.99 PENALTY.
   Except as otherwise specifically provided herein, whoever violates any
provision of this chapter is guilty of a misdemeanor of the third degree.
   The conviction and punishment of any person for transacting any business
without a license shall not excuse or exempt such person from the payment of
any license due or unpaid at the time of such conviction.
CHAPTER 709
Advertising, Billposters and Handbills
709.01   Definitions.
709.02   Posting prohibited in certain cases.
709.03   Scattering handbills in public places prohibited.   
709.04   Placing handbills in vehicles.
709.05   Distribution of handbills on uninhabited or vacant private premises.
709.06   Distribution prohibited where properly posted.
709.07   Distribution of handbills on inhabited private premises.
709.08   Identification of printer and distributor on handbill. (Repealed)

709.11   Use of premises for posting of objectionable material prohibited.
709.12   Offensive and immoral handbills.
709.13   Posting, marking without owner's consent.
709.14   Scattering billboard offal. (Repealed)
709.15   Marking, posting on City property.
709.16   Posting immoral or obscene pictures.
709.17   Tearing down lawful advertisements.

Power to regulate - see Ohio R.C. 715.65

541.04

905
Signs - see BLDG. Ch.
1308
Advertising on State and Interstate highways - see Ohio R.C. Ch. 5516
 
 
709.01 DEFINITIONS.
   The following words, terms and phrases, when used in this chapter, shall
have the meanings ascribed to them in this section, except where the context
clearly indicates a different meaning:
   (a)   "Billposter" means and includes any person engaging in the business
for hire of posting, fastening, nailing or otherwise affixing any written,
painted or printed matter of any kind or other form or reproduction thereof
(hereinafter called "sign") containing a message or information of any kind
whatsoever, to any outdoor billboard, or to or upon any bridge, fence, pole,
post, sidewalk, tree or to or upon the exterior of any other structure, except
that the terms of this definition (subsection (a)) shall not apply to nor
include any such sign mounted on, fastened to or suspended from the outside of
any building or other structure, in accordance with and authorized by any
provisions of an ordinance or statute, either for any public convenience or
use, or regulating the construction or use of so-called outdoor display signs
whether such display signs are illuminated or not.
   (b)   "Commercial handbill" means and includes any printed or written
matter, any sample or device, dodger, circular, leaflet, pamphlet, paper,
booklet or any other printed or otherwise reproduced original or copies of any
matter or literature:
      (1)   Which advertises for sale any merchandise, product, commodity or
thing;
      (2)   Which directs attention to any business, mercantile or commercial
establishment or other activity, for the purpose of either directly or
indirectly promoting the interests thereof by sales;
      (3)   Which directs attention to or advertises any meeting, theatrical
performance, exhibition or event of any kind for which an admission fee is
charged for the purpose of private gain or profit; but the terms of this
subsection shall not apply where an admission fee is charged or a collection is
taken up for the purpose of defraying the expenses incident to such meeting,
theatrical performance, exhibition or event of any kind, when either of the
same is held, given or takes place in connection with the dissemination of
information which is not restricted under the ordinary rules of decency, good
morals, public peace, safety and good order; provided, that nothing contained
in this subsection shall be deemed to authorize the holding, giving or taking
place of any meeting, theatrical performance, exhibition or event of any kind
without a license, where such license is or may be required by any law of this
State or under any ordinance of this City;
      (4)   Which, while containing reading matter other than advertising
matter, is predominantly and essentially an advertisement and is distributed or
circulated for advertising purposes or for the private benefit and gain of any
person so engaged as advertiser or distributor; or
      (5)   Which is not covered by the definition of "sign", in subsection
(a).
   (c)   "Handbill distributor" means and includes any person engaging or
engaged in the act or operation of distributing commercial or noncommercial
handbills other than newspapers distributed to subscribers thereof, and any
person receiving compensation directly or indirectly for the distribution of
such handbills.
   (d)   "Newspaper" means and includes any newspaper of general circulation as
defined by general law, any newspaper duly entered with the Post Office
Department of the United States in accordance with Federal statute or
regulation and any newspaper filed and recorded with any recording officer as
provided by general law; and, in addition thereto, shall mean and include any
periodical or current magazine regularly published with not less than four
issues per year and sold to the public.
   (e)   "Noncommercial handbill" means and includes any printed or written
matter, any sample or device, dodger, circular, leaflet, pamphlet, newspaper,
magazine, paper booklet or any other printed or otherwise reproduced original
or copies of any matter or literature not included in the aforesaid definitions
of a sign, of a commercial handbill or a newspaper.
   (f)   "Person" means and includes any person, firm, partnership,
association, corporation, company or organization of any kind.
   (g)   "Private premises" means and includes any dwelling, house, building or
other structure designed or used either wholly or in part for private
residential purposes whether inhabited or temporarily or continuously
uninhabited or vacant, and includes any yard, grounds, walk, driveway, porch,
steps, vestibule or mailbox belonging or appurtenant to such dwelling, house,
building or other structure.
   (h)   "Public place" means and includes any and all streets, boulevards,
avenues, lanes, alleys or other public ways, and any and all public parks,
squares, spaces, plazas, grounds and buildings.
   (i)   Words singular in form may include the plural; any words plural in
form may include the singular; and words in the masculine gender shall include
the feminine and neuter genders.
      (Ord. 1958-46. Passed 7-7-58.)
709.02 POSTING PROHIBITED IN CERTAIN CASES.
   No person shall post, stick, stamp, paint or otherwise fix or cause the same
to be done by any person, any notice, placard, bill, card, poster,
advertisement or other paper or device calculated to attract the attention of
the public, to or upon any sidewalk, cross walk, curb or any other portion or
part of any public way or public place, or any light pole, utility pole,
railway structure, hydrant, shade tree or tree box, or upon the piers, columns,
trusses, girders, railings, gates or other parts of any public bridge or
viaduct or other public structure or building, except such as may be authorized
or required by the laws of the United States, or State, and the ordinances of
the City. (Ord. 2016-104. Passed 9-26-16.)
709.03 SCATTERING HANDBILLS IN PUBLIC PLACES PROHIBITED.
   No person shall deposit, place, throw, scatter or cast any commercial or
noncommercial handbill in or upon any public place within this City. It shall
also be unlawful for any person to hand out, distribute or sell any commercial
handbill in any public place.
(Ord. 1958-46. Passed 7-7-58.)
709.04 PLACING HANDBILLS IN VEHICLES.
   No person shall distribute, deposit, place, throw, scatter or cast any
commercial or noncommercial handbill in or upon any automobile or other
vehicle. The provisions of this section shall not be deemed to prohibit the
handing, transmitting or distributing of any noncommercial handbill to the
owner or other occupant of any automobile or other vehicle who is willing to
accept the same.
(Ord. 1958-46. Passed 7-7-58.)
709.05 DISTRIBUTION OF HANDBILLS ON UNINHABITED OR VACANT PRIVATE PREMISES.
   No person shall distribute, deposit, place, throw, scatter or cast any
commercial or noncommercial handbill in or upon any private premises which are
temporarily or continuously uninhabited or vacant.
(Ord. 1958-46. Passed 7-7-58.)
709.06 DISTRIBUTION PROHIBITED WHERE PROPERLY POSTED.
   No person shall distribute, deposit, place, throw, scatter or cast any
commercial or noncommercial handbill upon any premises if requested by anyone
thereon not to do so or if there is placed on such premises in a conspicuous
position near the entrance thereof, a sign bearing the words: "no trespassing",
"no peddlers or agents", "no advertisement" or any similar notice indicating in
any manner that the occupants of such premises do not desire to be molested or
to have their right of privacy disturbed, or to have any such handbills left
upon such premises.
(Ord. 1958-46. Passed 7-7-58.)
709.07 DISTRIBUTION OF HANDBILLS ON INHABITED PRIVATE PREMISES.
   No person licensed under the provisions of this chapter, or any other
person, shall distribute, deposit, place, throw, scatter or cast any commercial
or noncommercial handbill in or upon any private premises which are inhabited,
except by handing or transmitting any such handbill directly to the owner,
occupant or any other person then present in or upon such private premises.
However, in the case of inhabited private premises which are not posted as
provided in this chapter, the aforesaid licensed or other person, unless
requested by anyone upon such premises not to do so, may place or deposit any
such handbill in or upon such inhabited private premises if such handbill is so
placed or deposited as to secure or prevent such handbill from being blown or
drifted about such premises or elsewhere, except that mailboxes may not be so
used when so prohibited by Federal postal laws or regulations.
(Ord. 1958-46. Passed 7-7-58.)
709.08 IDENTIFICATION OF PRINTER AND DISTRIBUTOR ON HANDBILL. (REPEALED)
   (EDITOR’S NOTE: Former Section
 709.08 was repealed by Ordinance 2016-111, passed September 26, 2016.)
709.09 DISTRIBUTORS; LICENSE AND FEE. (REPEALED)
   (EDITOR’S NOTE: Former Section
 709.09 was repealed by Ordinance 2016-112, passed September 26, 2016.)
709.10 EXEMPTIONS.
   The provisions of this chapter shall not be deemed to apply to the
distribution of mail by the United States, nor to newspapers as defined in this
chapter. Neither will the provisions apply to the distribution of election and
campaign literature distributed by or in behalf of a bona fide candidate or
issue.
(Ord. 1958-46. Passed 7-7-58.)
709.11 USE OF PREMISES FOR POSTING OF OBJECTIONABLE MATERIAL PROHIBITED.
   No owner, lessee, occupant or agent of premises shall permit any person,
whether licensed or acting under the terms of this chapter, or otherwise, to
post, affix or otherwise attach to any building, structure or fixture located
upon such premises, whether such fixture be natural or artificial, any poster
or handbill containing any matter prohibited by the terms of this chapter.
(Ord. 1958-46. Passed 7-7-58.)
709.12 OFFENSIVE AND IMMORAL HANDBILLS.
   No person shall post, hand out, distribute or transmit any sign or any
commercial or noncommercial handbill:
   (a)   Which may reasonably tend to incite riot or other public disorder, or
which advocates disloyalty to or the overthrow of the government of the United
States or of this State by means of any artifice, scheme or violence, or which
urges any unlawful conduct, or encourages or tends to encourage a breach of the
public peace or good order of the community or secondary boycott; or
   (b)   Which is offensive to public morals or decency, or which contains
blasphemous, obscene, libelous or scurrilous language.
      (Ord. 1958-46. Passed 7-7-58.)
709.13 POSTING, MARKING WITHOUT OWNER'S CONSENT.
   No person shall paint, print or otherwise mark or in any manner place upon
or affix to any building, fence, wall, tree or tree box, without the consent of
the owner thereof, or on any sidewalk without the consent of the owner or
occupant of the lot or land abutting thereon, any word, character, sentence or
device, or any handbill, placard or notice referring to or advertising any
profession, business or exhibition, amusement, performance or place of
amusement, or other thing, or the sale or manufacture of any property or
article, or cause or procure the same to be done.
709.14 SCATTERING BILLBOARD OFFAL. (REPEALED)
   (EDITOR’S NOTE: Former Section
709.14 was repealed by Ordinance 2016-105, passed September 26, 2016.)
709.15 MARKING, POSTING ON CITY PROPERTY.
   It shall be unlawful to paint or otherwise mark, or in any manner place
upon, or affix to any utility pole, electric light pole or on any building or
other property belonging to the City on any of the streets, alleys or other
public places within the City, any word, character or device or any handbill or
notice referring to or advertising any profession, business or occupation,
exhibition, amusement, performance or place of amusement or anything, or the
sale or manufacture of any property or article, or cause the same to be done.
(Ord. 2016-106. Passed 9-26-16.)
709.16 POSTING IMMORAL OR OBSCENE PICTURES.
   No person shall, within the limits of the City, post or cause to be posted
so that the same can be seen from the streets, alleys or other public places of
the City, any advertisement containing or displaying pictures or illustrations
of an unbecoming, obscene or immoral character.
709.17 TEARING DOWN LAWFUL ADVERTISEMENTS.
   No person shall tear down or mutilate any bill, placard or other
advertisement put up in a legal manner.
709.18 AUDIBLE ADVERTISING FROM VEHICLES.
   No person shall operate or park on any street any vehicle on which or
attached thereto there is any sound device used for the purpose of attracting
attention thereto, or from which any person calls or cries out for advertising
purposes.
709.99 PENALTY.
   Except as otherwise specifically provided herein, whoever violates any
provision of this chapter is guilty of a misdemeanor of the third degree.

CHAPTER 735
Garage Sales
735.01   Definition.
735.02   Compliance required.
735.03   Hours.
735.04   Frequency. (Repealed)
735.05   Sale of new merchandise prohibited.
735.06   Advertising; signs.
735.07   License required; fee.
735.08   Exemptions.
735.99   Penalty.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Theft by deception - see GEN. OFF.
545.05
 
 
735.01 DEFINITION.
   As used in this chapter "garage, basement, patio, barn, clothesline or yard
sale" means any public sale of personal property in the City.
(Ord. 1975-121. Passed 12-23-75.)
735.02 COMPLIANCE REQUIRED.
   No person shall conduct a garage, basement, patio, barn, clothesline or yard
sale in the City without first obtaining a license therefor and complying with
the regulations set forth in this chapter.
(Ord. 1975-121. Passed 12-23-75.)
735.03 HOURS.
   Garage, basement, patio, barn, clothesline and yard sales shall not commence
before 8:00 a.m. and must terminate by sundown.
(Ord. 2016-127. Passed 10-10-16.)
735.04 FREQUENCY. (REPEALED)
   (EDITOR’S NOTE: Former Section
 735.04 was repealed by Ordinance 2017-09, passed February 27, 2017.)
735.05 SALE OF NEW MERCHANDISE PROHIBITED.
   Garage, basement, patio, barn, clothesline and yard sales shall offer only
used unwanted items of personal property owned by the resident of the property
where the sale is held. No new merchandise shall be offered for sale nor may
new merchandise from other sources be brought in and offered for sale.
(Ord. 1975-121. Passed 12-23-75.)
735.06 ADVERTISING; SIGNS.
   Garage, basement, patio, barn, clothesline and yard sales may be advertised
through the newspaper or other news media. A sign, not greater than three feet
by three feet, may be installed on the property where the sale is being
conducted. No sign advertising such a sale shall be placed in or upon the
public right of way other than at the exact location where the sale is being
conducted. No lighted sign shall be used. Permitted signs shall be displayed
only during the sale and shall be promptly removed after the sale.
(Ord. 1984-53. Passed 7-24-84.)
735.07 LICENSE REQUIRED; FEE.
   No person shall conduct any garage, basement, patio, barn, clothesline or
yard sale without first obtaining a license therefor. Upon application, either
in person, by mail or by telephone, the City Manager is authorized to issue
such a license. The license shall set forth the name and address of the person
who will be conducting such sale and the date of the sale. There will be a
three day limit and one sale per month limit. There will be no sales between
November 15 and March 1. There shall be a fee of ten dollars ($10.00) for such
license.
(Ord. 2021-53. Passed 8-9-21.)
735.08 EXEMPTIONS.
   Sales sponsored and conducted by a nonprofit or charitable organization
shall be exempt from this chapter.
(Ord. 1975-121. Passed 12-23-75.)
735.99 PENALTY.
   Whoever violates or fails to comply with any provision of this chapter is
guilty of a minor misdemeanor. A separate offense shall be deemed committed
each day during or on which a violation or noncompliance occurs or continues,
and also shall be deemed committed for each individual sign placed or erected
in violation of this chapter.
CHAPTER 737
Junk Yards
737.01   Definitions.
737.02   License required; obscuring view; exception.
737.03   Issuance of license; fee; term.
737.04   Requirements as to fences.
737.05   Interpretation of chapter; revocation of licenses.
737.99   Penalty.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Secondhand dealers - see Ohio R.C. Ch. 4737
Record of transactions required - see Ohio R.C. 4737.01, 4737.04
Dealing with minors prohibited; hours regulated - see Ohio R.C. 4737.03
State licensing and required fencing of junk yards outside a municipality - see
Ohio R.C. 4737.05 et seq.
 
 
737.01 DEFINITIONS.
   As used in this chapter:
   (a)   "Junk" means old or scrap copper, brass, rope, rags, batteries, paper,
used lumber, rubber, junked, dismantled or wrecked automobiles or parts
thereof, iron, steel and other old or scrap ferrous or nonferrous materials,
junked or dismantled plumbing fixtures and fittings, including, but not limited
to, bathtubs, commodes, tanks, septic tanks, hot water tanks and all other
items of a similar kind, character or nature.
   (b)   "Junk yard" means an establishment or place of business which is
maintained or operated for the purpose of storing, keeping, buying or selling
junk.
   (c)   "Person" means an individual, partnership, association or corporation.
   (d)   "Fence" means an enclosure at least six feet in height so constructed
and maintained as to obscure the junk in such enclosure from ordinary view to
those persons passing upon the streets, sidewalks or avenues within the City.
      (Ord. 1964-38. Passed 5-13-64.)
737.02 LICENSE REQUIRED; OBSCURING VIEW; EXCEPTION.
   No junk yard shall be operated or maintained within the City without a
license and no license shall be granted to any person who fails or refuses to
comply with all the provisions of this chapter.
   Any junk yard operated or maintained under the provisions of this chapter
shall have the view obscured from the streets, avenues and sidewalks by natural
objects or a fence.
   The owners of junk yards located at places wherein unusual terrain or man-
made objects make it impossible to enclose such location shall, upon
application to the Mayor, receive waivers of those portions of this chapter
with which it is impossible for them to comply.
(Ord. 1964-38. Passed 5-13-64.)
737.03 ISSUANCE OF LICENSE; FEE; TERM.
   The City Manager shall have the sole authority to issue licenses for the
establishment, maintenance and operation of junk yards within the limits herein
defined and shall charge a fee of two hundred and fifty dollars ($250.00)
payable annually in advance. All licenses issued under this section shall
expire on December 31 each year. Licenses issued in the last six months of the
year shall be pro-rated.
(Ord. 2016-131. Passed 10-24-16.)
737.04 REQUIREMENTS AS TO FENCES.
   A fence constructed under this chapter shall be kept in good order and
repair and at all times painted and no advertisement shall be permitted thereon
other than the name of the person in whose name the license has been issued and
the nature of the business conducted therein.
(Ord. 1964-38. Passed 5-13-64.)
737.05 INTERPRETATION OF CHAPTER; REVOCATION OF LICENSES.
   Nothing contained in this chapter shall be so construed as to authorize or
permit any person to operate or maintain a junk yard in any restricted zone or
area, or in any manner constituting a common nuisance, nor to otherwise keep or
maintain any such junk yard in violation of any of the laws of the State or
ordinances of the City. The City Manager may revoke the license of any licensee
who violates any of the provisions of this chapter or fails or neglects to
properly obscure the view of such junk yard by natural objects or a properly
maintained fence as herein set forth and described.
(Ord. 2016-109. Passed 9-26-16.)
737.99 PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any provision of this chapter, whether a principal or
employee, is guilty of a misdemeanor of the third degree. Each day of violation
or failure to comply with any of the requirements of this chapter shall be
construed as a separate and distinct offense.
CHAPTER 741
Mechanical Amusement Devices (Repealed)
   EDITOR’S NOTE: Former Chapter
741 was repealed by Ordinance 2016-110, passed September 26, 2016.

Taxicab stands - see TRAF.
351.10
 
 
TAXICABS IN GENERAL
745.01 DEFINITIONS.
   As used in this chapter:
   (a)   "Taxicab" means any vehicle propelled by power other than muscular,
except omnibuses, funeral cars and public buses for the use of which, in the
carriage of passengers, a charge is made.
   (b)   "Person" means an individual, firm, corporation or other legal entity.
      (Ord. 1975-78. Passed 8-12-75.)
745.02 IDENTIFICATION.
   (a)   Every person owning and operating a taxicab under license from the
City may adopt any trade name, design, color scheme or method of painting or
lettering such taxicabs that may be approved by the City Manager. Such trade
name, design, color scheme or method of painting or lettering shall include the
following matter:
      (1)   The license number assigned to each taxicab, and painted on each
side and on the rear thereof.
      (2)   The name of the owner or the trade name under which he or it does
business, painted on each side of the taxicab.
   Whenever the name of the owner, or the trade name under which he or it does
business does not include any one of the words "taxicabs", "taxi" or "cab",
then the word "taxicab" shall be painted on each side of the taxicab
immediately beneath the name or trade name.
   (b)   Whenever any person owning or operating taxicabs does not adopt and
use an approved trade name, design, color scheme or method of painting and
lettering as hereinbefore mentioned, then it shall be mandatory for such person
to paint the following matter on each side of its taxicabs:
      (1)   A painted panel, enclosing on separate lines the name of the owner,
the word "taxicab" and the license number assigned to such taxicab by the City
Manager; such panel shall be painted on each side of the taxicab and shall
cover no less area than ten inches by twelve inches. The form of such panel
shall be substantially as follows:
John T. Smith
Taxicab
10
      (2)   The license number shall also be painted on the rear exterior of
the taxicab.
   (c)   All mandatory lettering and wording as provided in this section shall
be at least two inches in height and shall be of such color as in the opinion
of the City Manager will contrast distinctly with the color of the body of the
taxicab; provided, further, that the numbers on the sides and rear thereof
shall be no less than three inches in height and shall be painted with a
coloring matter in oil solution.
   (d)   No person shall cause or permit any taxicab to appear with a trade
name, design, color scheme or method of painting and lettering that is not
approved by the City Manager for the vehicle concerned, or that is not in
accordance with the terms of this section.
(Ord. 2016-114. Passed 9-26-16.)
745.03 CONDITION AND EQUIPMENT.
   Every public vehicle shall be kept in a safe and sanitary operating
condition and shall at all times have the following equipment:
   (a)   A light within the passenger compartment, capable of being lighted or
extinguished by the passenger.
   (b)   A spare tire, capable of being used on any of the wheels of the
vehicle.
   (c)   A set of tools for changing tires.
   Whenever a taxicab is found not to be in a safe and sanitary operating
condition or not to comply fully with all the requirements specified herein,
the City Auditor, upon the recommendation of the City Manager, shall suspend or
revoke the license of the public vehicle concerned.
(Ord. 2016-115. Passed 9-26-16.)
745.04 INSPECTION.
   For the purpose of determining the condition of any licensed taxicab as
provided in Section
745.03, the owner of such taxicab shall present it for inspection semi-annually
at such time and place as may be designated by the City Manager.
(Ord. 2016-116. Passed 9-26-16.)
745.05 SIZE; CAPACITY AND SEATING OF PASSENGERS.
   All taxicabs operating in the City shall be limited to five passengers,
except that taxicabs equipped with "jump seats" may be occupied by seven
passengers, including the driver.
(Ord. 1975-78. Passed 8-12-75.)
745.06 DEFRAUDING OPERATOR.
   No person, with intent to defraud the owner or operator of any taxicab,
shall engage carriage therein. Refusal to pay the lawful charge for such
carriage or to abscond without paying or offering to pay, shall be prima-facie
evidence of such intent to defraud.
(Ord. 1975-78. Passed 8-12-75.)
745.07 RAILROAD CROSSING.
   All taxicabs operating within the City shall stop at all railroad crossing
by bringing the taxicab to a complete stop before attempting to cross the
railroad.
(Ord. 1975-78. Passed 8-12-75.)
745.08 SCHEDULE OF RATES. (REPEALED)
   (EDITOR’S NOTE: Former Section
 745.08 was repealed by Ordinance 2016-117, passed September 26, 2016.)
745.09 SIZE AND DISPLAY OF RATE CARDS.
   Every taxicab licensed as provided in this chapter shall carry in it at all
times a rate card which shall be not less than three inches by five inches, and
shall be mounted under a transparent cover in the rear compartment or interior
of the vehicle, in such a position that it can be easily read by the occupants
thereof.
(Ord. 1975-78. Passed 8-12-75.)
745.10 CONTENTS OF RATE CARDS.
   The rate cards shall contain, in legible type, the name of the vehicle
owner, the license number of the vehicle, the date of issuance and the complete
schedule of rates of fare used as filed with the City Manager.
(Ord. 1975-78. Passed 8-12-75; Ord. 2019-05. Passed 1-28-19.)
745.11 TAMPERING WITH RATE CARD; REPLACEMENT.
   The rate card shall not be altered or tampered with by any person, and
whenever the same shall have become damaged, soiled or illegible, it shall be
the duty of the owner of such taxicab to replace the same.
(Ord. 1975-78. Passed 8-12-75.)
745.12 TAXICAB STANDS. (REPEALED)
   (EDITOR’S NOTE: Former Section
745.12 was repealed by Ordinance 2016-118, passed September 26, 2016.)
745.13 TAXICAB STATIONS. (REPEALED)
   (EDITOR’S NOTE: Former Section
745.13 was repealed by Ordinance 2016-119, passed September 26, 2016.)
745.14 TRANSPORTING ALCOHOLIC BEVERAGES PROHIBITED.
   No person shall use any taxicab to pick up, deliver or in any manner
transport alcoholic beverages of any type. Possession of such material within
any taxicab shall be grounds for the suspension of the license of such taxicab
and the suspension of the taxicab driver's license of the operator, in addition
to the penalty provided in Section
745.99.
(Ord. 1975-78. Passed 8-12-75.)
745.15 USE OF TAXICABS FOR PROSTITUTION, ETC.
   No driver of any taxicab shall permit any person to occupy or use such
vehicle for the purpose of prostitution, lewdness or assignation with knowledge
or reasonable cause to know that such vehicle is, or is to be, used for such
purposes, or direct, take or transport or offer or agree to direct, take or
transport any person to any building or place, or to any other person, with
knowledge or reasonable cause to know that the purpose of such directing,
taking or transporting is prostitution, lewdness or assignation.
(Ord. 1975-78. Passed 8-12-75.)
745.16 KEEPING OF LOGS.
   All licensed taxicab drivers, whether leased or otherwise, must keep a log
of all their trips, the place and time of pickup and the destination and time
of arrival there. All logs must be available for inspection at all times.
(Ord. 1975-78. Passed 8-12-75.)
LICENSING TAXICABS
745.18 TAXICAB LICENSE REQUIRED; FEE; DURATION.
   (a)   Every taxicab shall be licensed.
   (b)   Taxicabs shall be authorized to pick up and deliver passengers any
place within the City. The license fee for taxicabs shall be one hundred
dollars ($100.00) per year for each taxicab, payable to the City Auditor.
   (c)   Licenses shall be dated January 1 of each year and expire on December
31 of the year in which they are issued. However, if a license is issued after
July 1 of any license year, one-half of the yearly license fee for such public
vehicle shall be paid therefor, provided that such public vehicle has not been
in operation prior to July 1 of the license year without the owner of the
public vehicle having paid the required license fee thereon.
   (d)   The license fee as indicated by this section shall be an addition to
the fee required under the laws of the State on all motor vehicles.
(Ord. 1975-121. Passed 12-23-75.)
745.19 APPLICATION.
   Application for licenses for taxicabs shall be made by the owner thereof to
the City Manager through the Police Department upon blanks provided by the
Police Department and shall set forth the name and address of the owner of the
taxicab for which a license is desired, the make, the state license number, the
length of time the taxicab has been in use, the number of persons it is capable
of carrying, the motor power thereof, the name and address of the person from
which the vehicle was purchased and the date of such purchase and any other
information required by the Police Department.
(Ord. 2016-120. Passed 9-26-16.)
745.20 INSURANCE OR BOND.
   No license to operate any taxicab shall be issued or renewed by the City
Auditor, and it shall be unlawful to operate any such taxicab or permit such to
be operated unless and until the applicant shall provide to the City Manager a
copy of a policy or policies of liability insurance issued by a responsible
insurance company licensed to do business within the State, approved as to
sufficiency by the City Manager and as to legality by the City Solicitor,
providing indemnity for, or protection to, the insured against loss in the
amount provided for in this section and agreeing to pay within the limits of
the amounts fixed herein to any judgment creditor who shall have filed his suit
or filed notice of a claim for such loss with the City Manager during the
license year in which the injury occurred, or six months thereafter any final
judgment rendered against the insured by reason of the liability of the insured
to pay damages to others for bodily injuries, including death, at any time
resulting therefrom, and for damages to or destruction of property sustained
during the terms of the policy by any person other than the employees of the
insured and resulting from the negligent operation, maintenance or use of such
taxicabs.
   The policy of insurance aforesaid and the bond given in lieu thereof, as
hereinafter referred to, shall provide that in case the taxicab is operated,
maintained or used with the consent or acquiescence of the owner, by one other
than the owner, his agent or employee, and an injury results to person or
property as indicated above, due to the negligent operation, maintenance or use
of the taxicab, that the insurer or the obligors in the bond, as the case may
be, shall pay to any judgment creditor of the person so maintaining, using or
operating such taxicab, provided that the judgment creditor shall have filed
his suit, or filed notice of claim for such loss in all respects as is provided
for the judgment creditor of the insured in the foregoing paragraph.
   The policy or policies of insurance, and the sureties hereinbefore required,
shall be valid and effective for no less a period than that for which the
license is issued.
   The extent of the liability of the insured shall be, as to any one licensed
taxicab, the sum of one million dollars ($1,000,000) on account of injury to,
or death of, any one person in any one accident; and subject to such limit as
respects injury to, or death of, one person, three million dollars ($3,000,000)
on account of any one accident resulting in injury to, or death of, more than
one person; and one hundred thousand dollars ($100,000) on account of damage to
property in any one accident.
   In lieu of the policy or policies of insurance herein provided for, the
applicant may furnish a commercial bond executed by a surety company,
authorized to do business in the State, approved as to sufficiency by the City
Manager and as to legality by the City Solicitor, holding and binding the
principal and sureties to the same liability, and subject to the same
conditions as in the case of policies of insurance provided for hereunder. It
shall further be permissible for the applicant to furnish insurance as to
damages for personal injuries, including death, and indemnity bond as to
property damages, or vice versa.
   Every such policy or certificate of insurance or bond shall contain a clause
obligating the insurer or surety to give to the City Manager at least ten days'
written notice before the cancellation, expiration, lapse or other termination
of such insurance, or the expiration, withdrawal of the surety therefrom or the
termination of such bond; and the license granted shall expire upon the
termination of the insurance or bond, or upon the termination of the liability
of the insurer or surety thereon, in accordance with such notice, unless a new
policy or certificate of liability insurance or a new indemnity bond, approved
as hereinbefore provided, shall be substituted therefor. Failure to give the
notice required herein shall operate to continue the liability of the insurer
or surety for the benefit of persons injured or damaged, as the policy or bond
continued in full force or effect.
(Ord. 2016-132. Passed 10-24-16.)
745.21 ISSUANCE OF LICENSE; RECORDS.
   If the City Manager shall, after investigation, be satisfied that the
applicant is the owner of the taxicab for which a license is applied for and
that such taxicab is a safe and fit conveyance for public carriage, and that
public necessity and convenience justify the operation of the taxicab for which
the license is applied, he shall direct the City Auditor to issue a license to
the applicant upon payment of the proper license fee. The City Manager shall
keep a proper record of the vehicle authorized to be licensed, including
identification.
(Ord. 2016-121. Passed 9-26-16.)
745.22 TRANSFERABILITY.
   In the event a licensed taxicab shall cease to belong to the applicant or
shall become unsuitable for operation, the applicant may file an affidavit to
such effect with the City Manager, who may thereupon authorize the City Auditor
to transfer the applicant's license to another taxicab which shall be approved
by the City Manager.
(Ord. 2016-139. Passed 10-24-16.)
745.23 TRANSFER OF TAXICABS.
   No taxicab shall be transferred from one owner to another by the City
Auditor except after a finding of public convenience and necessity by the City
Manager. Such findings shall be arrived at in the same manner as in case of an
original application. The applicant for the transfer of a license shall file
with his application the consent, in writing, of the former owner of such
license, and shall comply with all the terms and conditions of this chapter.
   The City Manager may, upon the sale of any licensed taxicab, authorize the
City Auditor to transfer the license for such taxicab to the purchaser thereof,
upon such purchaser complying with the terms of Sections
745.18 through
745.29.
(Ord. 2016-142. Passed 10-24-16.)
745.24 DISPLAY OF LICENSE.
   No license shall be displayed on any taxicab except the one for which it was
issued. The license as hereinbefore provided for, shall be affixed to the
interior of such taxicab on the front part thereof in such a manner as to be
plainly discernible at all times.
(Ord. 1975-78. Passed 8-12-75.)
745.25 REPLACEMENT OF LOST OR STOLEN LICENSES.
   If any licensed owner of a taxicab loses his license as herein described or
if the license is stolen from him, a new license shall be delivered to such
owner upon certification by the City Manager that such licensed owner has filed
with the City Manager a sworn statement containing the facts covering such loss
or theft. The fee for this replacement shall be twenty dollars ( $20.00) per
license. (Ord. 2016-161. Passed 11-28-16.)
745.26 LICENSE TAGS.
   At the time a license is issued by the City Auditor to the owner of any
taxicab, the City Auditor shall also issue to such owner a written license upon
which shall be inscribed or printed the words "Licensed Taxicab", and also the
number of such license and the year in which it was issued. These licenses
issued each year shall be numbered consecutively, beginning with number one.
(Ord. 1975-78. Passed 8-12-75.)
745.27 DISPOSITION OF LICENSE UPON DISCONTINUANCE OF
       OPERATION.
   Every person to whom a license has been issued under the provisions of
Sections
745.18 through
745.29 shall, upon discontinuing or abandoning the operation of a taxicab,
prior to the expiration of the license, return such license to the City Auditor
unless the same has been lost or destroyed.
(Ord. 1975-78. Passed 8-12-75.)
745.28 OPERATION WITHOUT A LICENSE.
   No person shall operate or permit to be operated for hire a taxicab not
licensed. Whoever violates this section shall, in addition to the penalty
provided in Section
745.99, be barred from operating a taxicab within the City for a period of one
year from the date of the conviction.
(Ord. 1975-78. Passed 8-12-75.)
745.29 SUSPENSION AND REVOCATION.
   Whenever it appears, upon investigation and hearing by the City Manager,
that a license hereunder has been obtained by misrepresentation, or that the
owner has been convicted of allowing the taxicab so licensed to be used for
unlawful purposes, the City Manager shall notify the City Auditor of such facts
and the Auditor shall thereupon revoke the license.
   Any owner of a licensed taxicab who violates the provisions of this chapter,
in addition to being subject to the penalty as provided in Section
745.99 which may result from charges being filed by the Police Department, may
be suspended from the right to operate any taxicabs within the City for a
period of not more than one year.
(Ord. 2016-143. Passed 10-24-16.)
LICENSING DRIVERS
745.30 TAXICAB DRIVER'S LICENSE REQUIRED; EXCEPTION.
   No person shall drive a taxicab within the City until he has procured a
license to drive such taxicab as provided by Sections
745.30 through
745.39.
   Nothing in Sections
745.30 through
745.39 shall be construed to require a driver's license for drivers operating
taxicabs of any governmental units.
(Ord. 1975-78. Passed 8-12-75.)
745.31 APPLICATION.
   (a)   Every applicant for a license as a driver of a taxicab shall make
application to the City Manager on blank forms to be supplied by the City
Manager, which forms shall direct applicants to furnish such information as to
themselves as shall be required by the application of the City Manager and such
application shall be sworn to by the applicant before filing.
   In addition to the written application prepared by the City Manager, the
applicant must provide:
      (1)   Valid Ohio Driver’s License;
      (2)   Proof of lawful presence and proof of identity;
      (3)   Ohio Bureau of Motor Vehicles driver’s abstract;
      (4)   Letter of good standing from the City Tax Division; and
      (5)   PCI background check;
      (6)   Proof of insurance.
         (Ord. 2016-133. Passed 10- 24-16.)
745.32 ISSUANCE.
   If the City Manager is satisfied, after investigation by the Police
Department, that the applicant for a driver's license is a suitable and proper
person to operate a taxicab within the City, he shall notify the City Auditor
in writing and the City Auditor shall then issue a license to the applicant
upon payment of the proper fees.
(Ord. 2016-134. Passed 10-24-16.)
745.33 FEES.
   Every driver of a taxicab shall pay to the City Auditor a license fee of
thirty dollars ($30.00) per annum for the original license and fifteen dollars
($15.00) per annum, or any part thereof, for each renewal of such license.
However, any such renewal of the license that is issued after the expiration of
the original license or any renewal thereof as provided by Section
745.37 shall be considered as an original license under this section and the
fee therefor shall be thirty dollars ($30.00) per annum or any part thereof.
(Ord. 2016-158. Passed 11-28-16.)
745.34 DENIAL; TIME LIMITATION ON NEW APPLICATIONS.
   When the application for a license to drive a taxicab has been denied, no
new application for a license shall be considered for a period of three months.
(Ord. 1975-78. Passed 8-12-75.)
745.35 CONTENTS AND DISPLAY OF LICENSE.
   The license issued by the City Auditor to the driver of a taxicab shall be
in writing and it shall be the duty of the City Auditor to affix to such
license one of the photographs filed with the City Manager at the time
application for license is made as required by Section
745.31, which photograph shall be transmitted by the City Manager to the City
Auditor. Such license and photograph shall be at all times conspicuously
displayed in the vehicle driven by such driver.
(Ord. 2016-135. Passed 10-24-16.)
745.36 TRANSFERABILITY.
   The license to drive a taxicab shall not be assigned or transferred.
(Ord. 1975-78. Passed 8-12-75.)
745.37 RENEWALS.
   Any licensed driver of a taxicab who fails to procure a renewal of the
license within thirty days after the expiration thereof shall, before a renewal
of such license is issued to him, make a new application as in the case of
original applications. The City Auditor shall refuse to issue a renewal license
for a license to drive a taxicab whenever the City Manager shall request him to
withhold such renewal until such time as the applicant shall appear before the
City Manager.
(Ord. 2016-136. Passed 10-24-16.)
745.38 DISPOSITION OF LICENSE UPON DISCONTINUANCE OF DRIVING.
   Every person to whom a license has been issued under the provisions of
Sections
745.30 through
745.39 shall, upon discontinuing or abandoning the driving of a taxicab, prior
to the expiration of the license, return such license to the City Auditor
unless the same has been lost or destroyed, in which event the City Auditor
shall be notified. The company employing the driver shall be responsible for
insuring the return of licenses and notifications required by this section.
(Ord. 1975-78. Passed 8-12-75.)
745.39 SUSPENSION AND REVOCATION.
   Whenever it shall appear, upon investigation by the City Manager, that a
license hereunder has been obtained by misrepresentation, the City Manager
shall notify the City Auditor of such facts and the Auditor shall thereupon
revoke the license.
   No driver of a taxicab shall drive a taxicab during a period for which his
license has been suspended.
   Upon violation by any driver of a taxicab of any provisions of this chapter,
or of any traffic ordinance of the City, or if any such driver shall violate
any ordinance of the City or law of the State involving moral turpitude or be
found guilty of intoxication, in addition to being subject to the penalty as
provided in Section
745.99, the City Manager may direct the City Auditor to suspend forthwith any
license issued by him to such driver for a period not to exceed the unexpired
period of the license, or for a period of ninety days, whichever is the longer.
(Ord. 2016-137. Passed 10-24-16.)
745.99 PENALTY.
   Except as otherwise specifically provided herein, whoever violates any
provision of this chapter is guilty of a misdemeanor of the third degree.
CHAPTER 749
Theaters and Shows (Repealed)
   EDITOR’S NOTE: Former Chapter
749 was repealed by Ordinance 2016-138, passed October 24, 2016.
CHAPTER 753
Tourist and Trailer Camps
753.01   Definitions.

753.10   Approval of license applications.

753.12   Inspections.

753.14   Camp plan.
753.15   Water supply; common drinking vessels.
753.16   Service building, toilets, bathing and laundry facilities.
753.17   Waste and garbage disposal.
753.18   Limitation on number of occupants.
753.19   Office building; register; duties of attendant in charge.
753.20   Applicability of City and State laws to plumbing, electrical and

753.21   Parking trailers, campers and other objects or components outside
licensed campgrounds and impoundment.
753.99   Penalty.
