         Zoning Code Definitions - see P. & Z. Chap.
1143
1341.01 DEFINITIONS APPLICABLE.
   Certain words and phrases as used in this Housing Code are defined, for
purposes of this Housing Code, as set forth in this chapter.
(Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1341.02  APPROVED.
    "Approved" means approved by the Building Official, or by any other person
or board designated to give approval to the matter in question, pursuant to
this Housing Code or any other section of the Codified Ordinances which so
specifies.
(Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1341.03  BOARD.
   "Board" means the Board of Zoning Appeals, as created and existing under the
provisions of Chapter
1141 of the Zoning Code and the Nuisance Board of Appeals, as created and
existing under the provisions of Chapter
1313 of the Building Code.
(Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1341.04  BASEMENT.
   "Basement" means a portion of a building partly or entirely underground
whose ceiling or under part of the floor above is four (4) feet or less above
the average finished ground elevation. The "average finished ground elevation"
is the mean elevation of the finished grade around all of the exterior of the
building.
(Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1341.05 BATHROOM OR LAVATORY.
   "Bathroom" means a separate room which contains a toilet and lavatory
facilities and contains a bathtub and/or shower facilities.
(Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1341.06  BATHROOM SINK.
   "Bathroom sink" means a sink, usually located in a bathroom, designed and
used primarily for personal cleanliness.
(Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1341.07 BUILDING OFFICIAL.
   "Building Official" (or "Chief Building Official") means the individual,
designated by the City Engineer as being in charge of the Building Department,
including the authorized agent of such Building Official, the Housing Inspector
and any other person or board authorized to give approval under this Housing
Code.
(Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1341.08 CITY.
   "City" means the City of Portsmouth, Ohio.
(Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1341.09  CODE.
   "Code" means this Housing Code as contained in Title Five, Chapter
1341 through Chapter
1351, of this Part Thirteen, Building Code, and all other related sections of
the Codified Ordinances, referred to herein.
(Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1341.10 COMMUNAL BATHROOM.
   "Communal bathroom" means a bathroom which is used by the residents of more
than one (1) dwelling unit or by the residents of a lodging house or
cooperative dwelling house, as such terms are defined in the Zoning Code.
(Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1341.11 COMMUNAL KITCHEN.
   "Communal kitchen" means a kitchen which is used by the residents of more
than one (1) dwelling unit or by the residents of a lodging house or
cooperative dwelling house, as such terms are defined in the Zoning Code.
(Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1341.12  COOPERATIVE DWELLING.
   "Cooperative dwelling" means a structure that is arranged, designed and
intended to house multiple individual residents, and not a single-family or
multiple-families, with shared kitchen and bathroom facilities and a shared
living space. Each resident has access to their own sleeping room and the
number of occupants shall not exceed provisions set forth in this Code.
(Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1341.13 DOUBLE HOUSE OR DUPLEX OR TWO-FAMILY DWELLING.
   "Double house" (or "Duplex" or "Two-Family Dwelling") means a detached
dwelling arranged, intended or designed to be occupied by two (2) families
only, living side by side with a party wall between.
(Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1341.14  DWELLING.
   "Dwelling" means a building or structure used or designed or intended to be
used, all or in part, for residential purposes.
(Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1341.15  DWELLING UNIT.
   "Dwelling unit" means a group of rooms arranged, maintained or designed to
be occupied by a single family, or a group of individuals acting as a single
unit, and consisting of a complete bathroom with toilet, lavatory and tub or
shower facilities; one (1) and only one (1) complete kitchen or kitchenette
with approved cooking, refrigeration and sink facilities; approved living and
sleeping facilities. All of these facilities shall be in contiguous rooms and
used exclusively by such family and by any authorized persons occupying such
dwelling unit with the family. The words "dwelling unit", "apartment" and
"suite" shall be considered synonymous.
(Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1341.16  FAMILY.
   "Family" means a group of one (1) or more adults and their biological and/or
adoptive children, if applicable, living together as a unit. Adoptive or foster
children are children approved to be in the care of said adults by the
appropriate child services department.
(Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1341.17 FOUNDATION.
   "Foundation" means construction primarily below grade which provides support
for exterior walls or other structural parts of a building.
(Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
   
1341.18  PRIVATE GARAGE.
   "Private garage" means a detached accessory building or portion of the main
building designed to store non-commercial passenger automobiles and other
normal household accessories of the residents of the main building.
(Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
   
1341.19 HABITABLE FLOOR AREA or HABITABLE ROOM.
   "Habitable Floor Area" (or "Habitable Room") means the floor area or space
in a building designated for living, sleeping, eating or cooking. Bathrooms,
toilet rooms, closets, halls, storage and utility spaces are not considered
habitable floor areas.
(Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1341.20 HOUSING INSPECTOR.
   "Housing Inspector" means the authorized agent of the Building Department in
charge of inspecting dwelling units in order to verify the structure is in
compliance with the provisions of this Housing Code.
(Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1341.21  KITCHEN.
   "Kitchen" means a separate room containing a kitchen facility and having as
its primary purpose the preparation of food.
(Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1341.22 KITCHEN FACILITY.
   "Kitchen facility" means a room or space containing a kitchen sink, a
refrigerator and a cooking unit. (Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1341.23  KITCHEN SINK.
   "Kitchen sink" means a sink, located in a kitchen facility and designed and
used primarily for cleaning food and food preparation utensils.
(Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1341.24  LAUNDRY FACILITY.
   "Laundry Facility" means a room or space having as its primary purpose the
cleaning and drying of clothes or linen, and contains a sink.
(Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1341.25  MULTIPLE DWELLING OR MULTI-FAMILY DWELLING.
   "Multiple dwelling" (or "Multi-family Dwelling") means a building or portion
thereof designed for occupancy by three (3) or more families living
independently of each other.
(Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1341.26  OCCUPANT OR RESIDENT.
   "Occupant" (or "Resident") means a person over one (1) year of age living,
sleeping, cooking or eating in or having actual possession or permitted use of
a dwelling unit.
(Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1341.27 OPERATOR.
   "Operator" means a person who has charge, care or control of a dwelling
structure.
(Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1341.28  OWNER.
   "Owner" means the owner of the premises, or one (1) of the owners of the
premises if owned by more than one (1) person, including the holder of title
thereto subject to contract of purchase, a vendee in possession, a mortgagee or
receiver in possession, a lessee or joint lessees of the whole thereof, or an
agent or any other person, firm, corporation or fiduciary directly in control
of the premises. (Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1341.29  PERSON.
   "Person" means any person, firm, partnership, association, corporation,
company or organization or association of persons of any kind.
(Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1341.30  PORCH.
   "Porch" means an open or screened structure, including decks or terraces, to
the front, side or rear of a main dwelling.
(Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1341.31 PREMISES.
    "Premises" means a lot, parcel or plot of land including the buildings or
structures thereon. (Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1341.32 RENTAL DWELLING OR ROOMING HOUSE.
   "Rental Dwelling" (or "Rooming House") means a structure or part thereof
containing one (1) or more dwelling units, in which space is let to one (1) or
more persons or families by the owner or operator. (Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-
22.)
1341.33 SANITATION FACILITIES.
   "Sanitation facilities" means those fixtures contained in bathrooms or
kitchen facilities, together with the service and disposal systems necessary
for proper use of such fixtures.
(Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1341.34 SECONDARY OR ACCESSORY STRUCTURE.
   "Secondary Structure" (or "Accessory Structure") means a structure, the use
of which is incidental or accessory to that of the main building and which is
attached to the main building or located on the same premises with it.
(Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1341.35  SINGLE-FAMILY DWELLING.
   "Single-Family Dwelling" means a building intended or designed to be
occupied by not more than one (1) family or no more than five (5) individual
occupants.
(Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1341.36 SINK.
   "Sink" means a fixture other than a toilet or bathtub for supplying, holding
and disposing of water. (Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1341.37 SUPPLY OR SUPPLIED.
   "Supply" (or "Supplied") means paid for, furnished, provided by or under the
control of the owner or operator. (Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1341.38 UTILITY ROOM.
   "Utility room" means a room, other than a habitable room, containing laundry
facilities or heating equipment. (Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1341.39 VACANT.
   "Vacant" means a structure which is lacking habitual presence of human
beings who have a legal right to be on the premises, or at which substantially
all lawful residential occupancy has ceased, or which is substantially devoid
of contents. In determining whether a dwelling structure is vacant, it is
relevant to consider, among other factors, the percentage of the overall square
footage of the structure or floor area to the occupied space, the condition and
value of any items in the structure and the presence of rental or for sale
signs on the property; provided that a dwelling structure shall not be deemed
vacant if it has been used as a residence by a person entitled to possession
for a period of at least three (3) months within the previous nine (9) month
period and a person entitled to possession intends to resume residing at the
property; and further provided that a dwelling structure containing more than
one (1) dwelling unit shall be considered vacant when all of the dwelling units
within the structure are vacant. If an owner fails to obtain a Rental Dwelling
Permit for any structure for which a permit is required pursuant to Chapter
1347 of the Codified Ordinances, the structure will be presumed vacant.
(Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
CHAPTER 1343
Purpose and Scope
1343.01    Short title.
1343.02    Purpose.
1343.03    General scope.
1343.04    Existing buildings.
1343.05    Conflict.
1343.01 SHORT TITLE.
   The provisions of this Title Five (Chapters
1341 through
1351) shall be known and may be cited and referred to as "The Housing Code of
Portsmouth, Ohio" or "Housing Code" or "Minimum Housing Standards of
Portsmouth, Ohio".
(Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1343.02 PURPOSE.
   Within the scope of this Housing Code as hereinafter defined, the purpose of
this Housing Code is to establish minimum standards necessary to make all
dwelling structures safe, sanitary, free from fire and health hazards, fit for
human habitation and beneficial to the public welfare; to establish minimum
standards governing the maintenance of dwelling structures in such condition as
will not constitute a blighting or deteriorating influence on the neighborhood
and the community; to fix responsibilities for owners and occupants of dwelling
structures with respect to sanitation, repair and maintenance; to establish
additional standards for multiple dwellings; to authorize the inspection of
dwelling structures; to establish enforcement procedures; to authorize the
vacation or condemnation of dwelling structures unsafe or unfit for human
habitation and to fix penalties for violations.
(Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1343.03  GENERAL SCOPE.
   The provisions of this Housing Code shall be supplementary to all other
provisions of City ordinances relating to the construction, use and maintenance
of residential buildings and shall apply to all buildings or portions thereof,
except hotels, as defined as Small or Large Lodging in Chapter
1143, which are used or designed or intended to be used for residential
occupancy.
(Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1343.04  EXISTING BUILDINGS.
   Existing buildings or portions thereof presently used for residential
purposes may continue to be occupied for residential purposes if:
   (a)   The building complies with the provisions of this Housing Code, except
as to any variance heretofore specifically granted by the City, and
   (b)   The use and occupancy of the building is not in violation of any City
ordinances and applicable statutes of the State, including any rules and
regulations adopted pursuant to such ordinances or statutes.
      (Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1343.05 CONFLICT.
   (a)   Where a provision of this Housing Code is found to be in conflict with
a provision of any zoning, building, fire, safety or health ordinance or code
of the City existing on the effective date of this Housing Code, being
applicable to existing housing, the provision which establishes the higher
standard for the promotion and protection of the health and safety of the
people shall prevail. Where a provision of this Housing Code is found to be in
conflict with a provision of any other ordinance or code of the City existing
on the effective date of this Housing Code, which establishes a lower standard
for the promotion and protection of health and safety of the people, the
provisions of this Housing Code shall prevail, and such other ordinances or
codes are hereby declared to be repealed to the extent that they may be found
to be in conflict with this Housing Code.
   (b)   If any section, subsection, paragraph, sentence, clause or phrase of
this Housing Code should be declared invalid for any reason whatsoever, such
decision shall not affect the remaining portions of this Housing Code, which
shall remain in full force and effect, and to this end the provisions of this
Housing Code are hereby declared to be severable.
(Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
CHAPTER 1345
Administration, Enforcement and Penalty
1345.01    Inspections authorized; fees.
1345.02    Right-of-entry.
1345.03    Notice of violation.
1345.04    Remedies for noncompliance.
1345.05    Emergency order.
1345.06    Condemnation proceedings.
1345.07    Demolition and abatement expenses and costs.
1345.08    Right of appeal; fee.
1345.09    Powers of the Board.
1345.99    Penalty.
1345.01  INSPECTIONS AUTHORIZED; FEES.
   (a)   Upon the consent of the owner or tenant, the Housing Inspector or
their authorized agent is hereby authorized and directed to make inspections to
determine the condition of dwellings, dwelling units, rental dwellings, rooming
houses, and premises located within the City in order that they may perform the
duty of enforcing the provisions of this Housing Code.
   (b)   Where the owner or tenant gives consent for the purpose of an
inspection, examination and/or survey, the owner, operator, or occupant of
every dwelling, dwelling unit, rental dwelling, rooming house and rooming unit,
and upon being shown proper identification and written consent, shall give the
Housing Inspector or their authorized agent free access to such premises at any
reasonable hour for the purpose of such inspection, examination and survey.
(Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1345.02 RIGHT-OF-ENTRY.
   (a)   Unless entry is refused by an owner or tenet, upon presentation of
proper identification, the Housing Inspector may, at all reasonable times,
enter any dwelling structure, other structure or property in the City to
perform any duty imposed upon him by the Housing Code.
   (b)   When a property owner denies the Housing Inspector entry onto the
property for the purposes of making an inspection, the Housing Inspector may
apply for and obtain a search warrant in order to gain access to such property.
   (c)   Nothing contained in this section shall limit the right of immediate
entry by the Housing Inspector onto any property in the City when they
determine that an emergency exists.
(Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1345.03  NOTICE OF VIOLATION.
   It shall be the duty of the Housing Inspector to enforce the provisions of
this Housing Code. Whenever the Housing Inspector determines that there has
been a violation of any provision of this Housing Code, they shall give notice
of such violation(s) to the owner, agent, or operator of such structure and
order compliance therewith, as hereinafter provided. Such notice and order
shall:
   (a)   Be in writing on an appropriate form;
   (b)   Include a list of violation(s), refer to the section of this Housing
Code violated and order remedial action which, if taken, will affect compliance
with this Housing Code;
   (c)   Specify a reasonable time for compliance;
   (d)   Advise the owner, operator or occupant of the procedure for appeal;
   (e)   Be served upon the owner, operator or occupant in person; provided,
however, that such notice and order shall be deemed to be properly served upon
such person if a copy thereof is sent by registered mail and delivered to his
last known address and a copy is posted in a conspicuous place in or on the
dwelling affected.
      (Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1345.04 REMEDIES FOR NONCOMPLIANCE.
   (a)   Whenever the owner, agent, operator or occupant of a structure or
premises fails to comply with any notice of the Housing Inspector, the
Inspector may issue a notice to such owner, agent, operator or occupant,
ordering such structure or premises to be vacated within a reasonable period of
time, not to be less than ten (10) days.
      (1)   Any notice to vacate shall be issued in the manner provided in
Section
1345.03.
      (2)   The ten (10) day time period notice requirement does not apply to
emergencies, which situations are regulated by Section
1345.05.
      (3)   In addition to, or as an alternative to the notice to vacate the
premises, as set forth hereinabove, the City may, upon request by the Housing
Inspector, institute an action for compliance against an owner, agent, operator
or occupant of a structure who has failed to comply with any notice given by
the Inspector.
   (b)   Whenever the owner, agent, operator or occupant of a structure or
premises fails, neglects or refuses to timely comply with a notice to vacate
issued by the Housing Inspector, the Inspector may enforce the orders of such
notice of vacation and cause the structure or premises, or part thereof, to be
vacated in accordance with the terms of such notice.
   (c)   Whenever the owner, agent or operator of a structure or premises
fails, neglects or refuses to comply with a notice to demolish such structure,
or a part thereof, or a secondary or accessory structure, issued in accordance
with the provisions of this Housing Code, and when such structure is determined
by the Building Official to constitute a public nuisance in that it is
dangerous or injurious to the public health, safety and welfare, the Inspector
may request the Director of Law to institute legal proceedings or to take such
other action as may be necessary to abate the nuisance. The Inspector shall
further give notice, in the same manner as provided in Section
1345.03, informing the owner, agent or operator that unless a timely appeal is
filed pursuant to law, such determination and action shall be implemented.
(Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1345.05 EMERGENCY ORDER.
   Whenever the Housing Inspector finds that an emergency exists in dwellings
unfit for habitation which requires immediate action to protect the health and
safety of the residents or of the public, they may issue an order reciting the
existence of the emergency and requiring immediate vacation and repair or
demolition as deemed necessary to meet the emergency. Notwithstanding any other
provision of this Housing Code, such order shall take effect immediately. Any
person to whom such order is directed shall comply therewith immediately.
(Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1345.06  CONDEMNATION PROCEEDINGS.
   (a)   The designation of dwellings, dwelling units, rental dwellings or
rooming houses as unfit for human habitation and the procedure for the
condemnation and placarding of such structure shall be carried out in
compliance with the requirements set forth in this Building Code.
   (b)   Any dwelling, dwelling unit, rental dwelling or rooming house which is
found to have any of the following defects shall be condemned as unfit for
human habitation and shall be so designated and placarded by the Housing
Inspector;
      (1)   One which is so damaged, decayed, dilapidated, unsanitary, unsafe
or vermin-infested that it creates a serious hazard to the health or safety of
the occupants or of the public.
      (2)   One which lacks illumination, ventilation or sanitation facilities
adequate to protect the health or safety of the occupants or of the public.
      (3)   One which because of its general condition is unsanitary or
otherwise dangerous to the health or safety of the occupants or of the public.
   (c)   Any dwelling, dwelling unit, rental dwelling or rooming house
condemned as unfit for human habitation, and so designated and placarded by the
Housing Inspector, shall be vacated within a reasonable time, not less than ten
(10) days, as ordered by the Housing Inspector. If a dwelling, dwelling unit,
rental dwelling, or rooming house is not vacated within the time specified in
such vacation order, the Housing Inspector shall seek a court order in a court
of competent jurisdiction for the vacation of such dwelling or part thereof.
   (d)   If a property owner desires to comply with the provisions of the
notice of violation from the Housing Inspector, the owner or their agent shall
obtain a permit from the Housing Inspector granting them restricted access in
order to correct the defects upon which the condemnation order was given.
   (e)   No dwelling, dwelling unit, rental dwelling or rooming house which has
been condemned and placarded as unfit for human habitation shall again be used
for human habitation until written approval is secured from and such placard
removed by, the Housing Inspector. The Housing Inspector shall remove such
placard whenever the defects upon which the condemnation and placarding action
were based have been eliminated.
   (f)   No person shall deface or remove the placard from any dwelling,
dwelling unit, rental dwelling or rooming house which has been condemned as
unfit for human habitation and placarded as such.
   (g)   Any person affected by any notice or order relating to the condemning
and placarding of a dwelling, dwelling unit, rental dwelling, or rooming house
as unfit for human habitation may request and shall be granted a hearing on the
matter before the Board of Zoning Appeals under the procedure set forth in
Section
1345.08 of this Housing Code.
(Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1345.07  DEMOLITION AND ABATEMENT EXPENSES AND COSTS.
   Any expense or cost incurred under the provisions for demolition or
abatement contained in this Housing Code shall be paid by the owner of the
structure or premises. If the demolition or abatement costs are incurred by the
City, Section
1313.06 shall govern the recovery of costs for such demolition or abatement.
(Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1345.08  RIGHT OF APPEAL; FEE.
   (a)   The owner, agent or operator of any structure or premises shall have
the right to appeal to the Board of Zoning Appeals any order, written notice or
determination by the Housing Inspector. Such appeal must be submitted on
appropriate forms supplied by the City and failure to file a written appeal
with the appropriate Board within thirty (30) days from the date such order,
notice or determination was given, mailed or issued shall constitute a waiver
of the right to appeal. Except in cases of emergency, as set forth in Section
1345.05, filing of an appeal from any such order, written notice or
determination shall suspend enforcement proceedings until the appeal is acted
upon by the Board.
   (b)   Each application or appeal to the Board of Zoning Appeals shall be
accompanied by a fee of one hundred, twenty-five dollars ($125.00). Each appeal
will be held in an open public meeting with the Board and notification of such
meeting will be mailed to pertinent surrounding neighbors. (Ord. 2022-95.
Passed 11-28-22.)
1345.09  POWERS OF THE BOARD.
   The Board of Zoning Appeals shall have the power to hear and decide appeals
from any order, requirement, decision or determination of the Housing Inspector
or other city official which involves an interpretation or application of the
provisions of this Housing Code.
(Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1345.99 PENALTY.
   (a)   Whoever violates any provision of this Housing Code is guilty of a
misdemeanor of the third degree. Every day such violation continues shall
constitute a separate offense.
   
   (b)   Whoever or fails, neglects or refuses to comply with any written
notice or written order issued by the Housing Inspector or Building Official as
described in Section
1345.03, or whoever refuses to permit entry by the Housing Inspector or other
City Officials or their representatives at a reasonable hour, or whoever
interferes with, obstructs or hinders the Housing Inspector or their authorized
representatives while attempting to make inspections, shall be fined not more
than five hundred dollars ($500.00) or imprisoned not more than six (6) months,
or both. Each day such violation occurs or continues shall constitute a
separate offense.
(Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
CHAPTER 1347
Rental Dwelling and Rooming House Permit
1347.01    Permit required.
1347.02    Application.
1347.03    Zoning approval required.
1347.04    Maximum occupancy.
1347.05    Fees.
1347.06    Transfer of ownership.
1347.07    Permit issuance; contents, term and revocation.
1347.08    Expirations and renewals.
1347.09    Display of permit.
1347.10    Suspension and reinstatement; fees.
1347.01  PERMIT REQUIRED.
   No owner, agent or operator of any dwelling structure used or designed or
intended to be used, as a single-family dwelling, two (2) family dwelling,
multi-family dwelling, or cooperative dwelling, shall rent or lease such
structure for residential occupancy unless the owner thereof holds a valid
permit issued by the Building Department for such structure, which permit has
not expired, been revoked or otherwise become null and void.
(Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1347.02 APPLICATION.
   The owner, agent, or operator of a dwelling structure used or designed, or
intended to be used, as a single-family dwelling, two (2) family dwelling,
multi-family dwelling, or cooperative dwelling shall apply to the Building
Department and pay the appropriate fees for a rental dwelling or rooming house
permit, on forms provided by the Building Department and shall include the
following:
   (a)   Name, address, and contact information of the property owner or their
agent.
   (b)   Name, address, and contact information of the building operator if
different than owner.
   (c)   Address or tax parcel number of the dwelling intended to be let.
   (d)   Intended use of the dwelling (i.e., single family, multi-family,
cooperative dwelling).
   (e)   Number of dwelling units, if more than single family dwelling.
      (Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1347.03 ZONING APPROVAL REQUIRED.
   Any person applying for a rental dwelling or rooming house permit shall
include zoning compliance verification from the Building Department.
(Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1347.04 MAXIMUM OCCUPANCY.
   The rental dwelling or rooming house permit shall state the maximum number
of persons who may occupy the rental dwelling or rooming house as determined by
this code and other ordinances of the City of Portsmouth, Ohio.
(Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1347.05 FEES.
   An application for a rental dwelling or rooming house permit for any
residential property in the City shall be accompanied by the following fees:
 
Dwelling Units per Building Fee Amount
1                           $100
2                           $150
Each additional Unit        $25
(Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1347.06  TRANSFER OF OWNERSHIP.
   (a)   Any person selling or otherwise relinquishing ownership or control of
a rental dwelling or rooming house for which a rental dwelling or rooming house
permit has been issued shall notify the Building Department of said change in
ownership within five (5) days of the effective date of the transfer. Such
notice shall be in writing and shall include:
      (1)   The name and address of the new owner.
      (2)   The name and address of the previous owner.
      (3)   The agent for the new owner.
   (b)   The rental dwelling or rooming house permit issued to the former owner
shall become null and void within thirty (30) days of the recorded date of such
change in ownership. The new owner intending to rent or lease a single-family
dwelling, two (2) family dwelling, multi-family dwelling, or cooperative
dwelling shall apply for a new permit from the Building Department and pay the
appropriate fees within thirty (30) days after such change of ownership has
occurred. (Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1347.07  PERMIT ISSUANCE, CONTENTS, TERM AND REVOCATION.
   (a)   Application for a rental dwelling or rooming house permit required by
the provisions of this Housing Code shall be made annually by supplying
necessary information to determine compliance with applicable laws, ordinances,
rules and regulations for the existing use or occupancy or the intended use or
occupancy on forms supplied by the Building Department.
   (b)   The Housing Inspector may require the submission of a certificate of
occupancy stating such information, and he may cause a general inspection of
the structure or premises to be made; provided, however, that in the case of a
double house or two (2) family dwelling which has all of the separate units
occupied by tenants in common, joint tenants, or other co-owners, the Inspector
shall not cause a general interior inspection of the structure other than upon
request, complaint or under emergency situations. And further provided that, in
situations where one (1) unit of such double house or two (2) family dwelling
is owner-occupied, with the remaining unit occupied by those persons other than
the owner, the Inspector shall not cause a general interior inspection other
than upon request, complaint or under emergency situations.
   (c)   If a building or other structure is found in compliance with the
provisions of this Housing Code, and all other laws, ordinances, rules and
regulations applicable thereto, the Housing Inspector shall issue a permit for
such building or structure, which shall contain the following information:
      (1)   The street address or other identifying characteristics of the
building or other structure.
      (2)   The name and address of the owner and, if the owner does not reside
on the premises, the name and address of the resident agent in charge of the
building or structure, and the name and address of the nonresident agent, if
any.
      (3)   The exact nature and extent of the use or occupancy authorized.
      (4)   The period for which such permit is issued.
   (d)   The Housing Inspector shall have the power to revoke a permit if any
of the following conditions have been determined:
      (1)   False statement is made by the applicant in connection with the
issuance of such permit.
      (2)   For noncompliance of a structure or its use with the requirements
of the Housing Code.
      (3)   If the owner, agent or person in charge of a structure refuses to
comply with any applicable provisions of this Housing Code.
      (4)   If the structure is being maintained or used in such a manner as to
constitute a public nuisance. In the event the Housing Inspector determines to
revoke a permit for the reason that the structure is being maintained in such a
manner as to constitute a public nuisance, the owner of said structure shall
have the right to appeal the revocation to the Nuisance Board of Appeals
pursuant to Section
 1313.05 of the Codified Ordinances and the Notice of Revocation shall advise
the owner of the right of appeal.
         (Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1347.08 EXPIRATIONS AND RENEWALS.
   (a)   Every rental dwelling or rooming house permit shall be renewed one (1)
year from the date of issuance.
   (b)   Failure to apply or renew a permit shall be deemed to be a violation
of this Housing Code and shall subject the owner of the structure to the legal
action and penalty prescribed herein.
(Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1347.09  DISPLAY OF PERMIT.
   (a)   The owner, agent or person in charge of every multiple dwelling
structure shall cause a permit to be posted conspicuously at all times at the
main entrance of such structure. The permit shall be provided with a protective
covering and shall be securely affixed to the wall.
   (b)   The owner or owner's agent of a dwelling structure, other than a
multiple dwelling structure, requiring a permit, shall have such permit
available on the licensed premises, or otherwise readily available, for
exhibition to the Housing Inspector or other authorized City personnel.
   (c)   The display or accessibility of the permit is part of the rental
inspection requirements. Failure to display or provide the permit is punishable
of a fine up to one hundred fifty dollars ($150,00).
(Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1347.10  SUSPENSION AND REINSTATEMENT; FEES.
   (a)   If a rental dwelling or rooming house, either entirely or a portion
thereof, has received a notice of violation from the Housing Inspector or Code
Enforcement Inspector as described in Section
1345.03 or Section
1313.03, the permit of such rental dwelling or rooming house may be subject to
suspension.
   (b)   At the end of the time allowed for correction of violations cited, the
Housing Inspector or Code Enforcement Inspector, lacking sufficient documentary
evidence of compliance, shall reinspect the rental dwelling or rooming house.
If they determine that such conditions have not been corrected, they may issue
an order suspending the operating permit.
   (c)   Any person whose permit to operate a rental dwelling or rooming house
has been suspended shall be entitled to a reconsideration of the order by the
Nuisance Board of Appeals in the manner herein provided. If no request for
reconsideration or appeals reaches the Board within fourteen (14) days
following receipt of an order of suspension, the permit shall be revoked,
except that prior to revocation any person whose permit has been suspended may
request reinspection, upon a showing that the violation(s) cited in the notice
have been corrected.
   (d)   When the owner or agent has been ordered by the Housing Inspector or
Code Enforcement Inspector to correct violations that may exist in a dwelling,
the inspector shall reinspect the property to verify compliance with the
original order. If additional inspections are required, due to noncompliance, a
fee to be established by ordinance shall be assessed to the owner for each
additional inspection. A reinstatement fee of fifty dollars ($50.00) shall be
established by ordinance.
(Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
CHAPTER 1349
Minimum Standards for Residential Dwellings
1349.01    Minimum standards; requirements.
1349.02    Foundations, exterior walls and roofs.
1349.03    Floors, interior walls and ceilings.
1349.04    Windows and exterior doors.
1349.05    Stairways and porches.
1349.06    Plumbing fixtures.
1349.07    Bathroom floor surfaces.
1349.08    Maintenance of required equipment and utilities.
1349.09    Egress.
1349.10    Private access to sleeping rooms.
1349.11    Street numbers.
1349.12    Habitable floor area.
1349.13    Calculation of floor area.
1349.14    Sleeping rooms.
1349.15    Cellars.
1349.16    Basements.
1349.17    Windows, ventilation and openable space.
1349.18    Lighting.
1349.19    Heating capacity.
1349.20    Supply of heat.
1349.21    Fireplace conversion requirements.
1349.22    Prohibited locations of heating equipment.
1349.23    Flue connections required.
1349.24    Automatic gas control valves.
1349.25    Smoke detectors required.
1349.26    Sanitation facilities.
1349.27    Water line connection.
1349.28    Garbage and rubbish collection.
1349.29    Cooking equipment.
1349.30    Use of gasoline or kerosene as fuel prohibited.
1349.31    Responsibilities of owners, operators and occupants.
1349.01  MINIMUM STANDARDS; REQUIREMENTS.
   (a)   No person shall occupy as owner-occupant or shall let to another for
occupancy any dwelling, dwelling unit, rental dwelling or rooming house which
does not comply with the following minimum standards for residential dwellings.
   (b)   Every dwelling, dwelling unit, rental dwelling or rooming house shall
contain within its walls the following:
      (1)   Minimum habitable floor area for the number of occupants.
      (2)   One (1) kitchen or kitchen facility.
      (3)   At least one (1) bathroom with a bathtub or shower facilities.
      (4)   Approved heating appliance capable of supplying heat to all
habitable rooms. (Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1349.02  FOUNDATIONS, EXTERIOR WALLS AND ROOFS.
   Every foundation, exterior wall and exterior roof shall be substantially
weathertight, watertight and rodent-proof, shall be kept in sound condition and
good repair and shall be safe to use and capable of supporting the load which
normal use may cause to be placed thereon.
(Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1349.03  FLOORS, INTERIOR WALLS AND CEILINGS.
   (a)   All interior walls, floors and ceilings of every dwelling structure
shall be maintained free of damage, including, but not limited to, any physical
openings of one-eighth inch (1/8") or greater and/or loose, damaged or
deteriorated materials such as paint, wallpaper or plaster. All walls,
excluding brick or stone walls, shall have a decorative coating of paint,
wallpaper or other protective substance located therein, or thereon, and
maintained in a clean and proper condition. Any wall or ceiling which has been
plastered or otherwise repaired shall thereafter be painted or papered to match
the remaining surface of the wall or ceiling. A wall may be covered with
paneling in lieu of paint or wallpaper, but such paneling shall be maintained
in good repair and replaced if it becomes severely scratched, faded or damaged.
   (b)   All interior floors of every dwelling structure shall be free of weak
areas, missing members, water damage, rotted portions and holes.
(Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1349.04  WINDOWS AND EXTERIOR DOORS.
   Every window, exterior door and basement or cellar door and hatchway shall
be substantially weathertight, watertight and rodent-proof, and shall be kept
in sound working condition and good repair.
(Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1349.05 STAIRWAYS AND PORCHES.
   Every inside and outside stair and porch, and any appurtenance thereto,
shall be safe to use, capable of supporting the load that normal use may cause
to be placed thereon, and kept in sound condition and good repair.
(Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1349.06 PLUMBING FIXTURES.
   Every plumbing fixture shall be properly installed and maintained in sound
mechanical condition, free from defects, leaks and obstructions, and in
accordance with Title Three - Plumbing Code of the Codified Ordinances of the
City of Portsmouth.
(Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1349.07 BATHROOM FLOOR SURFACES.
   Every water closet compartment floor surface and bathroom floor surface
shall be constructed and maintained so as to be waterproof and non-absorbent to
water and so as to permit such floor to be easily kept in a clean and sanitary
condition.
(Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1349.08 MAINTENANCE OF REQUIRED EQUIPMENT AND UTILITIES.
   Every supplied facility and piece of utility equipment which is required
under this Housing Code, and every chimney and smoke pipe, shall be so
constructed and installed that it will function safely and effectively, and
shall be maintained in sound working condition.
(Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1349.09 EGRESS.
   Each dwelling or dwelling unit shall be provided with direct and approved
means of access and egress to the outside of the dwelling structure.
(Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1349.10 PRIVATE ACCESS TO SLEEPING ROOMS.
   Access to sleeping rooms shall be had without passing through other rooms
used as sleeping rooms or bathrooms.
(Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1349.11 STREET NUMBERS.
   Every dwelling structure shall have the correct street number of such
dwelling prominently displayed so that it is clearly visible at all times from
the street in front of the property. The numbers shall be numerals, not in
script, and they must be at least three inches (3") high and in contrasting
colors. Such numbers shall be placed in close proximity to the main front
entrance to the building. (Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1349.12  HABITABLE FLOOR AREA.
   Every dwelling unit shall contain the following minimum habitable floor
area:
 
Number of Occupants      Minimum Habitable Floor Area (SF)
1                        150
Each Additional Occupant 100
   For the purpose of this section a person under one (1) year of age shall not
be counted as an occupant.
(Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1349.13  CALCULATION OF FLOOR AREA.
   Floor area shall be calculated on the basis of habitable floor area.
However, closet area and hall area within the dwelling unit, where provided,
may count for not more than five percent (5%) of the required habitable floor
area.
(Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1349.14 SLEEPING ROOMS.
   In every dwelling unit, the floor area for every room occupied for sleeping
purposes shall be as followed:
 
Number of Occupants      Minimum Sleeping Room Area (SF)
1                        60
Each Additional Occupant 40
(Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1349.15  CELLARS.
   No cellar shall be used for living purposes.
(Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1349.16  BASEMENTS.
   No basement shall be used for living purposes unless:
   (a)   The floors and walls are substantially watertight;
   (b)   The total window area, total openable area and ceiling height are in
accordance with this Housing Code;
   (c)   The required minimum window area of every habitable room is entirely
above the grade of the ground adjoining such window area, not including stair
wells or accessways.
   (d)   No room or space in the basement of any dwelling shall be used as a
sleeping room or kitchen facility.
      (Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1349.17  WINDOWS, VENTILATION AND OPENABLE SPACE.
   (a)   Habitable Rooms. The minimum total window area of every habitable
room, other than a sleeping room, shall be ten percent (10%) of the floor area
of such room, at least forty-five percent (45%) of such window area to be
openable.
   (b)   Sleeping Rooms. The minimum total window area of every sleeping room
with one hundred square feet (100 SF) or less of floor area shall be ten
percent (10%) of the floor area. The minimum total window area of every
sleeping room with more than one hundred square feet (100 SF) of floor area be
ten square feet plus two percent (2%) of each square foot of floor area over
one hundred square feet (100 SF).
   (c)   Glass-Fronted Porches.  For the purpose of this section, where a
living room faces onto a glass-fronted porch, the porch shall be considered as
part of the living room if the total window and open area between the porch and
the living room is at least fifteen percent (15%) of the floor area of the
living room.
   (d)   Bathrooms.  Every bathroom and water closet compartment shall have at
least one window facing to the outdoors and have a minimum openable area of
four percent (4%) of the floor area of such room except where there is supplied
some other device approved by the Building Inspector as affording adequate
ventilation.
   (e)   Laundry Rooms.  Every laundry room shall have a minimum openable area
of at least six (6) square feet except where there is supplied some other
device approved by the Building Inspector as affording adequate ventilation.
   (f)   Insufficient Air Space. Whenever a window of a room faces a wall or
other portion of any abutting structure which is located less than three (3)
feet from the window and extends to a level above that of the ceiling of the
room, the window shall not be counted in calculating window area or openable
area.
   (g)   Skylight-Type Windows. A skylight-type window shall be considered as a
window for the purpose of this section except in the case of a kitchen with
more than fifty (50) square feet in floor area, a living room or a sleeping
room.
   (h)   Public Halls and Stairways. Each public hall and stairway in every
two-family dwelling, multi-family dwelling and rooming house shall be
adequately ventilated.
(Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1349.18 LIGHTING.
   Every dwelling shall be supplied with electricity as follows:
   (a)   Habitable Rooms. Every habitable room shall contain at least two (2)
separate approved floor or wall-type electric convenience outlets, or one (1)
such convenience outlet and one supplied ceiling-type electric light fixture.
   (b)   Bathrooms, Utility Rooms. Every water closet compartment, bathroom,
laundry room and furnace room, shall contain at least one (1) supplied ceiling-
type electric light fixture. A wall-mounted type can be used provided it is
mounted a minimum of five (5) feet above the finished floor measured from the
center of the outlet box for the mounting fixture.
   (c)   Public Halls.  Every public hall in a dwelling shall contain at least
one (1) supplied ceiling or wall-type electric light fixture.
   (d)   Two-family Dwellings, Multi-family Dwellings and Rooming Houses.
Every public hall and stairway in every two-family dwelling, multi-family
dwelling and rooming house shall be adequately lighted at all times except that
in a two-family dwelling an adequate lighting system which may be turned on
when needed by conveniently located light switches shall be permitted instead
of a full-time lighting system.
   (e)   Standards for Installation. Every outlet and fixture shall be properly
installed and maintained in good and safe working condition and shall comply
with applicable City codes and ordinances.
      (Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1349.19  HEATING CAPACITY.
   (a)   Every dwelling shall have heating facilities which are capable of
safely and adequately heating all habitable rooms, bathrooms and water closet
compartments within its walls to a temperature of at least sixty-eight (68)
degrees Fahrenheit (20 degrees Celsius) when the outside temperature is minus
five (-5) degrees Fahrenheit (-22 degrees Celsius) at a point three (3) feet
above the floor.
   (b)   Portable heating equipment employing a flame and heating equipment
using gasoline or kerosene do not meet the standards of this Housing Code and
are prohibited.
(Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1349.20  SUPPLY OF HEAT.
   The owner, agent or operator in charge of a dwelling structure, who rents or
leases any dwelling unit therein under an agreement, expressed or implied, to
supply or furnish heat by a permanent heating fixture to the occupants thereof,
shall supply heat adequate to maintain an inside temperature of not less than
sixty-eight (68) degrees Fahrenheit (20 degrees Celsius), in all habitable
rooms, bathrooms, water closet compartments and kitchens at all times when the
outdoor temperature is minus five (-5) degrees Fahrenheit (-22 degrees Celsius)
or warmer, without forcing the facilities to operate in excess of their
designed capacity. Such inside temperature shall be measured in the approximate
center of each room, approximately three (3) feet above the floor. The
provisions of this section shall not apply where the failure to meet minimum
standards is caused by a general shortage of fuel, neglect or malicious act of
the occupant, or any cause beyond the control of the owner or occupant.
(Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1349.21 FIREPLACE CONVERSION REQUIREMENTS.
   (a)   Fireplaces which were designed for gas grills or space heaters shall
not be converted to a wood-burning unit unless a chimney expert submits in
writing that the hearth is fireproof and the chimney is fire-clay lined and
free from leaks and that the combustion chamber is of proper size.
   (b)   Fireplaces shall be maintained so as to be free from missing mortar
and missing or broken bricks. The fireplace damper shall be maintained so as to
operate properly.
   (c)   Fireplace hearth forms used in the construction of the hearth shall be
removed, if visible. (Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1349.22 PROHIBITED LOCATIONS OF HEATING EQUIPMENT.
   No heating equipment, including water heaters, which burn solid, liquid or
gaseous fuel shall be located in any bedroom, bathroom, toilet room, or any
room used for sleeping purposes, or hallways above the first floor, unless
specifically approved for such use.
(Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1349.23  FLUE CONNECTIONS REQUIRED.
   (a)   Every appliance or piece of equipment burning solid, liquid or gaseous
fuel, where permitted, shall be connected to an approved smoke pipe and flue.
However, any appliance approved for use without such connection is exempted
from the requirements of this section.
   (b)   Gas dryers shall be vented to the exterior of the building. All other
dryers shall be vented to the exterior of the dwelling unless manufacturer's
instructions stipulate an alternative.
(Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1349.24 AUTOMATIC GAS CONTROL VALVES.
   All gas-fired heating equipment, including water heaters, shall be equipped
with approved automatic main gas control valves which will automatically turn
off the gas supply in the event of pilot outage, or gas or electrical supply
failure.
(Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1349.25 SMOKE DETECTORS REQUIRED.
   (a)   Every dwelling unit within the City shall have one (1) approved smoke
detector installed outside each sleeping area, in the immediate vicinity of the
bedrooms, and an additional detector on each additional story of the family
living unit, including basements and finished attics, but excluding unfinished
attics and crawl spaces. In new construction, a smoke detector shall also be
installed in each sleeping room.
   (b)   In "split level" dwelling units which contain adjacent levels with
less than one (1) full story separation, the installation of a smoke detector
on an upper level shall suffice for the next adjoining lower level, unless
there is an intervening door between the adjacent levels, in which case a smoke
detector shall be installed on each level.
(Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1349.26  SANITATION FACILITIES.
   Every dwelling unit shall contain within its walls:
   (a)   Lavatory Facilities. A room, separate from the habitable rooms, which
affords privacy and which is equipped with a flush water closet.
   (b)   Basin. A lavatory basin located in the same room as the required flush
water closet. The flush water closet can be partitioned off in the room, as
long as the flush water closet and/or basin are not in a habitable room.
   (c)   Bathtub or Shower. A room, separate from the habitable room, which
affords privacy to a person in the room and which is equipped with a bathtub or
shower. This can be part of the lavatory facilities.
   (d)   Kitchen Sink.  A kitchen sink in good working order.
      (Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1349.27 WATER LINE CONNECTION.
   (a)   Every kitchen sink, lavatory basin and bathtub or shower required by
this Housing Code shall be properly connected with both hot and cold water
lines. The hot water lines shall be connected with supplied water heating
facilities which are capable of heating water to such a temperature as to
permit an adequate amount of water to be drawn at every required kitchen sink,
lavatory basin and bathtub or shower at a temperature of not less than 120
degrees Fahrenheit, even when the heating facilities required by this Housing
Code are not in operation.
   (b)   All plumbing fixtures required by this section shall be properly
connected to the approved water system and to the approved sewerage system of
the City, unless approved otherwise by the Board of Health of the City.
(Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1349.28 GARBAGE AND RUBBISH COLLECTION.
   (a)   Every occupant of a dwelling or dwelling structure shall dispose of
all rubbish in a clean and sanitary manner by placing it in plastic bags of
sufficient strength to support the load of which it carries, which shall then
be placed in approved receptacles or in other approved rubbish disposal
facilities until (1/2) hour before sunset the day prior to rubbish disposal
pick-up, but no later than 7:00 a.m. on the day of rubbish disposal pick-up, at
which time the bags and receptacles shall be placed on the curb line or edge of
pavement where the dwelling resides.
   (b)   No approved receptacles or bags shall be placed on the public
sidewalk.
(Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1349.29  COOKING EQUIPMENT.
   Every piece of cooking equipment shall be so constructed and installed that
it will function safely and effectively and shall be maintained in sound
working order.
(Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1349.30 USE OF GASOLINE OR KEROSENE AS FUEL, PROHIBITED.
   Portable cooking equipment employing flame and cooking equipment using
gasoline or kerosene as fuel for cooking are prohibited.
(Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1349.31 RESPONSIBILITIES OF OWNERS, OPERATORS AND OCCUPANTS.
   (a)   Sanitation.
      (1)   Every occupant of a dwelling, dwelling unit or rooming unit shall
maintain in a clean and sanitary condition that part of the dwelling, dwelling
unit and yard which they occupy and control, and shall be responsible for their
own misuse of areas and facilities available in common.
      (2)   Every owner or operator of a two-family dwelling, multi-family
dwelling or rooming house shall maintain in a clean and sanitary condition the
shared or public areas of the dwelling and yard.
      (3)   Every occupant of a dwelling unit shall keep all supplied
facilities, including plumbing fixtures and cooking equipment, in a clean and
sanitary condition and shall be responsible for the exercise of reasonable care
in their proper use and operation.
   (b)    Removal of Waste Matter.
      (1)   Every occupant of a dwelling unit shall dispose of all rubbish,
ashes, garbage and other organic waste in a clean and sanitary manner by
placing it in approved storage or disposal facilities which are safe and
sanitary. Every occupant shall provide such facilities for and within his
dwelling unit and shall maintain them in a clean and sanitary manner.
      (2)   Every owner or operator of every rooming house shall dispose of all
rubbish in a clean and sanitary manner by placing it in supplied and approved
storage or disposal facilities which are safe and sanitary.
   (c)   Extermination of Habited Structures.
      (1)   Every occupant of a dwelling unit shall be responsible for the
extermination of any insects, rodents or other pests in it or in the yard. In a
two-family dwelling or a multi-family dwelling the occupant shall be
responsible for such extermination whenever his dwelling unit is the only one
infested. When however, infestation is caused by failure of the owner or
operator to maintain a dwelling in a rodent-proof or substantially insect-proof
condition, extermination shall be the responsibility of the owner or operator.
      (2)   Every owner or operator shall be responsible for extermination of
any insects, rodents or other pests whenever infestation exists in two or more
of the dwelling units in any dwelling or in the shared or public areas of any
two-family dwelling or any multi-family dwelling.
      (3)   Every owner or operator of a rooming house shall be responsible for
extermination of any insects, rodents or other pests in it or in the yard.
   (d)    Heating.
      (1)   During that time of the year when it is necessary, as determined by
the Housing Inspector, every owner or operator of a two-family dwelling, multi-
family dwelling and rooming house shall supply adequate heat to every habitable
room therein except where there are separate heating facilities for each
dwelling unit, which facilities are under the sole control of the occupant of
such dwelling unit.
   (e)   Utilities.
      (1)   No owner, operator or occupant shall cause any service equipment or
utility which is required by this Housing Code to be removed, shut off or
discontinued for any occupied dwelling let or occupied by him, except for such
temporary interruption as may be necessary while actual repairs or alterations
are in progress or during temporary emergencies.
   (f)   Transfer of Responsibility.
      (1)   A contract effective as between owner and operator, operator and
occupant or owner and occupant, with regard to compliance hereunder, shall not
relieve any part of his direct responsibility under this Housing Code.
   (g)    Notice of Maximum Occupancy.
      (1)   Every owner or operator shall advise the occupant in writing,
either by insertion in the lease between the parties or otherwise, of the
maximum number of occupants permitted in the occupied premises under this
Housing Code.
   (h)   Accessory Buildings.
      (1)   Every accessory building is to have a solid foundation extending
eighteen (18) inches below grade line under same or a foundation resting on
piers spaced not more than six (6) feet apart. Walls of accessory buildings are
not to lean or list and are to be vertical. All unsafe accessory buildings,
buildings without foundations and buildings which are listing or leaning, are
to be removed.
         (Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
CHAPTER 1351
Additional Standards for Multi-Family Dwellings
1351.01    Additional requirements.
1351.02    Access and egress.
1351.03    Identification of dwelling units.
1351.04    Other uses in multi-family dwellings.
1351.05    Fire protective features.
1351.06    Lighting of public or common areas.
1351.07    Janitor.
1351.08    Garbage and rubbish collection.
1351.09    Shared sanitation facilities.
1351.01 ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS.
   In addition to any other applicable provision of this Housing Code, the
standards and regulations set forth in this chapter shall apply to multi-family
dwellings within the City.
(Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1351.02 ACCESS AND EGRESS.
   (a)   Every multiple dwelling shall have at least two (2) continuous flights
of stairs extending from the entrance floor to the top floor, and at least one
(1) such flight of stairs shall connect directly with an entrance hall. All
staircases over one (1) riser in height shall have a properly installed and
maintained hand railing on one (1) side of such stairway adjacent to such
stairs. An open stairway shall have a railing installed on the open side.
   (b)   Every multiple dwelling, that does not have direct egress to the
outside, shall have direct access to a public hall or walkway which connects to
the stairways leading to the entrance floor.
   (c)   Any open public walkway, not on the entrance floor, shall have a
railing installed on the open side. (Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1351.03 IDENTIFICATION OF DWELLING UNITS.
   (a)   Each dwelling unit shall be identified with permanent numerals or
letters placed on the front entrance of such dwelling units. For purposes of
this section, the use of permanent script letters shall not be deemed
sufficient identification and shall be supplemented with numerals.
   (b)   In the event that the multiple dwelling maintains separate entrances
for the separate suites or groups of suites, each entrance shall have posted
therein a list of the suites which are accessible therefrom.
   (c)   Where installed, mailboxes shall be properly maintained and
operational.
   (d)   Where installed, buzzer systems shall be maintained and operational.
   (e)   Where installed, bars and security grills shall be maintained.
   (f)   Where installed, exterior lightings shall be maintained on the fire
escapes and driveways. (Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1351.04 OTHER USES IN MULTI-FAMILY DWELLINGS.
   No other use shall be maintained in any multiple dwelling structure unless
such use is so located and arranged so that it does not constitute a health or
safety hazard to the residential occupants of the building and is provided with
approved means of egress and ingress, and there exists or are provided approved
toilet accommodations separate from those provided for the occupants residing
in the building.
(Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1351.05 FIRE-PROTECTIVE FEATURES.
   Every multiple dwelling shall be provided with fire-protective features
approved as being adequate for the protection of the occupants thereof. The
minimum requirements for such protection are as follows:
   (a)   Every public hallway, corridor, stairway, exit or other means of
egress shall be protected against fire with construction, other than doors,
having a fire resistance rating of not less than three-quarters (3/4) of an
hour and shall be kept clear and unobstructed at all times, so as to afford
safe passage from each dwelling unit to open space at ground level.
   (b)   All doors into interior stairways shall be windowless, solid core or
approved equivalent, self-closing doors. All doors used for egress into public
hallways or corridors, other than into interior stairways, shall be windowless,
solid core or approved equivalent doors.
   (c)   The underside of any stairway located above a basement stairway or
cellar stairway shall be protected by material having a fire resistance rating
of not less than three-quarters (3/4) of an hour.
   (d)   Basement or cellar stairways shall be separated from the first floor
level by openings protected by self-closing doors having a fire resistance
rating of not less than three-quarters (3/4) of an hour.
      (Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1351.06 LIGHTING OF PUBLIC OR COMMON AREAS.
   (a)   In every multiple dwelling, all public hallways, corridors and
stairways shall be provided at all times with natural or artificial
illumination equal to at least three (3) foot-candles on every part of such
area.
   (b)   All other common areas, such as boiler rooms, laundries, basements,
locker rooms, meter rooms and cellars, shall be provided with electrical
lighting facilities, which, when lighted, will provide illumination equal to at
least three (3) foot-candles on every part of such area.
   (c)   The Building Official shall have the authority to increase the
requirements of subsections (a) and (b) hereof if, in their opinion, the degree
of reflected light is not adequate for safety.
   (d)   In addition to the requirements contained in subsections (a), (b) and
(c) hereof, the following are required to be maintained:
      (1)   An approved UL listed pull-chain fixture at the following
locations:
         A.   At the distribution panel.
         B.   At the furnace area.
         C.   At the laundry area.
      (2)   A fixture at the foot of the basement stairs shall have a switch
control at the top of the stairs.
         (Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1351.07  JANITOR.
   In any multiple dwelling with five (5) or more units, and in which the owner
does not reside, there shall be designated by the owner a janitor, custodian,
agent, operator or other responsible person, who shall be considered the
resident agent and who shall reside in the multiple dwelling and have charge of
it.
(Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1351.08  GARBAGE AND RUBBISH COLLECTION.
   (a)   Every occupant of a dwelling unit in a multi-family dwelling shall
dispose of all garbage and other organic waste, which might provide food for
insects and rodents, in a clean and sanitary manner by placing it in plastic
bags of sufficient strength to support the load which it shall contain, which
shall then be placed in approved, non-leakable, non-absorbent, covered garbage
storage receptacles or in other approved garbage disposal facilities until (1/
2) hour before sunset the day prior to rubbish disposal pick-up, but not later
than 7:00 a.m. on the day for rubbish disposal pickup, at which time the bags
and receptacles shall be placed on the curb line or edge of pavement of the
dwelling.
   (b)   The owner or operator of a multi-family dwelling shall be responsible
for the clean and sanitary maintenance of common storage or disposal
facilities. They shall be responsible further for placing out for collection
all common garbage and rubbish containers, except where such facilities are for
the sole use of an occupant, under which circumstances it shall be the
responsibility of the occupant to place these containers out for collection.
(Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
1351.09  SHARED SANITATION FACILITIES.
   The occupants of not more than two (2) adjacent dwelling units, not
exceeding four (4) people, which are located in the same dwelling may share a
single flush water closet, a single lavatory basin and a single bathtub or
shower, provided:
   (a)   Neither of the two (2) dwelling units contains more than two (2)
rooms. However, for the purpose of this subsection, a kitchen with not more
than fifty square feet (50 SF) of floor area is not counted as a room.
   (b)   The habitable room area of each of such dwelling units aggregates not
more than two hundred and fifty square feet (250 SF).
   (c)   The water closet and lavatory basin as well as the bathtub and shower
are within a room, separate from the habitable rooms, which affords privacy and
which is accessible to the occupants of each dwelling unit without going
through any portion of the dwelling unit of another person or outside the
dwelling. Where there is more than one (1) sleeping room in a dwelling unit,
access to the bathroom must be provided without going through a sleeping room.
   (d)   The bathtub or shower is within a room, separate from the habitable
rooms, which affords privacy and which is accessible to the occupants of each
dwelling unit without going through the dwelling unit of another person or
outside the dwelling.
      (Ord. 2022-95. Passed 11-28-22.)
CHAPTER 1353

1353.01   Minimum standards.

1353.03   Use of gasoline or kerosene as fuel.

1353.01 MINIMUM STANDARDS.
   No owner, operator or occupant shall furnish or use any cooking equipment
which does not comply with the following minimum standards.
(Ord. 1963-38. Passed 4-11-63.)
1353.02 CONSTRUCTION AND MAINTENANCE.
   Every piece of cooking equipment shall be so constructed and installed that
it will function safely and effectively and shall be maintained in sound
working order.
(Ord. 1963-38. Passed 4-11-63.)
1353.03 USE OF GASOLINE OR KEROSENE AS FUEL.
   Portable cooking equipment employing flame and cooking equipment using
gasoline or kerosene as fuel for cooking are prohibited.
(Ord. 1963-38. Passed 4-11-63.)
CHAPTER 1355
Responsibilities of Owners, Operators and Occupants
1355.01   Sanitation.
1355.02   Removal of waste matter.
1355.03   Extermination of habited structures.
1355.04   Heat.
1355.05   Utilities.
1355.06   Janitorial service.
1355.07   Transfer of responsibility.
1355.08   Notice of maximum occupancy.
1355.09   Accessory buildings.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Inspections - see BLDG.
1343.02
Condemnation proceedings - see BLDG.
